<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_CA75614_AUDITED_CONSOLIDATED_ANNUAL_FI__AUD03584">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_TOC_CA75614_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	AUDITED CONSOLIDATED ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND
<BR>
	MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Except sections specifically referenced below which shall be deemed incorporated by reference herein and filed, no other portion of the TransCanada
	Corporation 2014 Annual report to shareholders except as otherwise specifically incorporated by reference in the TransCanada Corporation Annual information form shall be deemed filed with the
	U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission (the&nbsp;"Commission") as part of this report under the Exchange&nbsp;Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Audited Annual Financial Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For audited consolidated financial statements, including the auditors' report, see pages 121 through 182 of the TransCanada Corporation 2014 Annual report to shareholders
	included herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's Discussion and Analysis
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For management's discussion and analysis, see pages 21 through 120 of the TransCanada Corporation 2014 Annual report to shareholders included herein under the heading
	"Management's discussion and&nbsp;analysis".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	C.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management's Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For management's report on internal control over financial reporting, see "Management's report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting" that accompanies the audited
	consolidated financial statements on page&nbsp;121 of the TransCanada Corporation 2014 Annual report to shareholders included herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNDERTAKING_AND_CONSENT>
<A NAME="FIS_UNDERTAKING_AND_CONSENT"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_CC75614_UNDERTAKING">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_TOC_CC75614_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	UNDERTAKING
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Registrant undertakes to make available, in person or by telephone, representatives to respond to inquiries made by the Commission staff, and to
	furnish promptly, when requested to do so by the Commission staff, information relating to: the securities registered pursuant to Form&nbsp;40-F; the securities in relation to which the obligation
	to file an annual report on Form&nbsp;40-F arises; or transactions in said securities.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNDERTAKING_AND_CONSENT>

<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_CC75614_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_FINANCIAL_EXPERT">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_TOC_CC75614_3">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	AUDIT COMMITTEE FINANCIAL EXPERT
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Registrant's Board of Directors has determined that it has at least one audit committee financial expert serving on its Audit committee.
	Mr.&nbsp;Kevin E. Benson and Mr.&nbsp;Siim A. Vanaselja have been designated audit committee financial experts and are independent, as that term is defined by the New&nbsp;York Stock Exchange's
	listing standards applicable to the Registrant. The Commission has indicated that the designation of Mr.&nbsp;Benson and Mr.&nbsp;Vanaselja as audit committee financial experts does not make
	Mr.&nbsp;Benson or Mr.&nbsp;Vanaselja "experts" for any purpose, impose any duties, obligations or liability on Mr.&nbsp;Benson or Mr.&nbsp;Vanaselja that are greater than those imposed on
	members of the Audit committee and Board of Directors who do not carry this designation or affect the duties, obligations or liability of any other member of the Audit committee.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>

	CODE OF ETHICS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

	its website at www.transcanada.com. No waivers have been granted from any provision of the code during the 2014 fiscal&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<A NAME="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_CC75614_FORWARD-LOOKING_INFORMATION">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_TOC_CC75614_9">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We disclose forward-looking information to help current and potential investors understand management's assessment of our future plans and financial
	outlook, and our future prospects overall.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Statements
	that are
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	forward-looking
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	are based on certain assumptions and on what we know and expect today and generally include words like
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	anticipate, expect, believe, may, will, should,
	estimate
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	or other similar&nbsp;words.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Forward-looking
	statements in this document may include information about the following, among other&nbsp;things:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	anticipated business prospects
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our financial and operational performance, including the performance of our subsidiaries
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	expectations or projections about strategies and goals for growth and&nbsp;expansion
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	expected cash flows and future financing options available to us
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=10,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=79437,FOLIO='BLANK',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]BG75605A.;14',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DE75605_1_2">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=4>
	Presentation of information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Throughout this Annual information form (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	AIF
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), the terms,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	we
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	us
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	our
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	the Company
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TransCanada
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mean TransCanada Corporation and its subsidiaries. In particular,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TransCanada
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	includes
	references to TransCanada PipeLines Limited (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	TCPL
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). Where TransCanada is referred to with respect to actions that occurred prior to its 2003 plan of
	arrangement (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Arrangement
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) with TCPL, which is described in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TransCanada
	Corporation&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Corporate structure
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	section below, such actions were taken by TCPL or its subsidiaries. The term
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	subsidiary
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, when referred to in this AIF, with
	reference to TransCanada means direct and indirect wholly owned subsidiaries of, and legal entities
	controlled by, TransCanada or TCPL, as&nbsp;applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Unless
	otherwise noted, the information contained in this AIF is given at or for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Year End
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). Amounts are
	expressed in Canadian dollars unless otherwise indicated. Information in relation to metric conversion can be found at
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Schedule&nbsp;A
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to&nbsp;this
	AIF. The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Glossary
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	found at the end of this AIF contains certain terms defined throughout this AIF and abbreviations and acronyms that may not otherwise
	be defined in this&nbsp;document.

	information is presented in accordance with United&nbsp;States generally accepted accounting principles (

</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). We use certain financial
	measures that do not have a standardized meaning under GAAP and therefore they may not be comparable to similar measures presented by other entities. Refer to the
</FONT>

	About this
	document&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Non-GAAP measures
</I>

	section of the MD&amp;A

	prospects overall.

<EFX_CORPORATE_STRUCTURE>
<A NAME="FIS_CORPORATE_STRUCTURE"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CORPORATE STRUCTURE
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our head office and registered office are located at
	450&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;1st&nbsp;Street S.W., Calgary, Alberta, T2P&nbsp;5H1. TransCanada was
	incorporated pursuant to the provisions of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Canada Business Corporations Act
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CBCA
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) on
	February&nbsp;25, 2003 in connection with the Arrangement, which established TransCanada as the parent company of TCPL. The Arrangement was approved by TCPL common shareholders on April&nbsp;25,
	2003 and, following court approval and the filing of Articles of Arrangement, the Arrangement became effective May&nbsp;15, 2003. Pursuant to the Arrangement, the common shareholders of TCPL
	exchanged each of their TCPL common shares for one common share of TransCanada. The debt securities and preferred shares of TCPL remained obligations and securities of TCPL. TCPL continues to carry on
	business as the principal operating subsidiary of TransCanada. TransCanada does not hold any material assets directly other than the common shares of TCPL and receivables from certain of TransCanada's
	subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=12,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=760660,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DE75605A.;8',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DE75605_1_4">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	INTERCORPORATE RELATIONSHIPS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following diagram presents the name and jurisdiction of incorporation, continuance
	or formation of TransCanada's principal subsidiaries as at Year End. Each of the
	subsidiaries shown has total assets that exceeded 10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the total consolidated assets of TransCanada or revenues that exceeded 10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the total
	consolidated revenues of TransCanada as at Year End. TransCanada beneficially owns, controls or directs, directly or indirectly, 100&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the voting shares in each of these
	subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G179857.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="582" HEIGHT="349">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	above diagram does not include all of the subsidiaries of TransCanada. The assets and revenues of excluded subsidiaries in the aggregate did not exceed 20&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the total
	consolidated assets of TransCanada as at Year End or total consolidated revenues of TransCanada for the year then&nbsp;ended.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=4>
	General development of the business
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	operate our business in three segments:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Natural Gas Pipelines
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Liquids Pipelines
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Energy
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Natural Gas
	Pipelines and Liquids Pipelines are principally comprised of our respective natural gas and liquids pipelines in Canada, the U.S.
	and Mexico as well as our regulated natural gas storage operations in the U.S.&nbsp;Energy includes our power operations and the non-regulated natural gas storage business in&nbsp;Canada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Summarized
	below are significant developments that have occurred in our Natural Gas Pipelines, Liquids Pipelines and Energy businesses, respectively, and certain acquisitions, dispositions, events or
	conditions which have had an influence on that development, during the last three financial years and year to date in&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DEVELOPMENTS IN THE NATURAL GAS PIPELINES BUSINESS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Canadian Regulated Pipelines
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_5"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NGTL System
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Horn River project was completed, extending the NGTL System into the Horn River shale play in British Columbia (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.C.
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). The total contracted volumes for Horn River,
	including the extension, are expected to be approximately 900&nbsp;million cubic&nbsp;feet per day (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	MMcf/d
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) by 2020.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The National Energy Board (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NEB
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) approved the Leismer-Kettle River Crossover project, a 77&nbsp;km (46&nbsp;miles) pipeline to expand the NGTL System with the intent of
	increasing capacity to meet demand in northeastern Alberta.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB issued its recommendation to the Governor-in-Council that the proposed Chinchaga Expansion component of the Komie North project be approved, but denied the proposed Komie North Extension component.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Leismer-Kettle River Crossover project was placed into service. The cost of the expansion was $150&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received an NEB Safety Order (the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Order
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) in response to the recent pipeline releases on the NGTL System. The Order required us to reduce the maximum operating pressure on
	three per&nbsp;cent of NGTL's pipeline segments. We filed a request for a review and variance of the Order that would minimize gas disruptions while still maintaining a high level of safety.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB approved approximately $400&nbsp;million in NGTL facility expansions that were in various stages of development or construction.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB granted the review and variance request with certain conditions. We are accelerating components of our integrity management program to address the NEB Order.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We continue to experience significant growth on the NGTL System as a result of growing natural gas supply in northwestern Alberta and northeastern B.C. from unconventional gas plays and substantive growth in intra-basin
	delivery markets. This demand growth is driven primarily by oil sands development, gas-fired electric power generation and expectations of B.C. west coast LNG projects. This demand for NGTL System services is expected to result in approximately
	4.0&nbsp;billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) of incremental firm services with approximately 3.1&nbsp;Bcf/d related to firm receipt services and 0.9&nbsp;Bcf/d related to firm delivery services. We will be seeking regulatory approvals in 2015 to
	construct new facilities to meet these service requests of approximately 540&nbsp;km (336&nbsp;miles) of pipeline, seven compressor stations, and 40&nbsp;meter stations that will be required in 2016 and 2017 (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2016/17&nbsp;Facilities
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). The estimated total capital cost for the facilities is approximately $2.7&nbsp;billion. Including the new 2016/17&nbsp;Facilities, the North Montney Mainline, the Merrick Mainline, and other
	new supply and demand facilities, the NGTL System has approximately $6.7&nbsp;billion of commercially secured projects in various stages of development.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	North Montney Mainline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We signed agreements for approximately two&nbsp;Bcf/d of firm gas transportation services to underpin the development of a major pipeline extension and expansion of the NGTL System to receive and transport natural gas
	from the North Montney area of B.C. The proposed North Montney Pipeline will include an interconnection with our proposed PRGT (as&nbsp;defined below) project to provide natural gas supply to the proposed Pacific NorthWest liquefied natural gas
	(
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	LNG
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) export facility near Prince Rupert, B.C. and is expected to cost approximately $1.7&nbsp;billion, which includes $100&nbsp;million for downstream facilities. Under commercial arrangements, receipt
	volumes are expected to increase between 2016 and 2019 to an aggregate volume of approximately two Bcf/d and delivery volumes to the PRGT project are expected to be approximately 2.1&nbsp;Bcf/d beginning in 2019. We also entered into arrangements
	with other parties for transportation services that will utilize the North Montney project facilities.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed an application with the NEB to construct and operate the North Montney Pipeline.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB issued a Hearing Order for the North Montney Pipeline. The proposed project consists of approximately 300&nbsp;km (186&nbsp;miles) of pipeline and is expected to be placed in service in two sections, Aitken Creek
	in second quarter 2016 and Kahta in second quarter 2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The hearing for the application before the NEB to build and operate this project concluded. We expect the NEB to issue its report and recommendations for the project by the end of April&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Merrick Mainline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced the signing of agreements for approximately 1.9&nbsp;Bcf/d of firm natural gas transportation services to underpin the development of a major extension of our NGTL System. The proposed Merrick Mainline will
	transport natural gas sourced through the NGTL System to the inlet of the proposed Pacific Trail Pipeline that will terminate at the Kitimat LNG Terminal at Bish Cove near Kitimat, B.C. The proposed project will be an extension from the existing
	Groundbirch Mainline section of the NGTL System beginning near Dawson Creek, B.C. to its end point near the community of Summit Lake, B.C. The $1.9&nbsp;billion project will consist of approximately 260&nbsp;km (161miles) of 48-inch diameter pipe.
	Subject to the necessary approvals, which includes the regulatory approval from the NEB for us to build and operate the pipeline, and a positive final investment decision (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FID
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) for the Kitimat LNG
	project, we expect the Merrick Mainline to be in service in first quarter 2020.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenue Requirement Settlements
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December 2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The current settlements for the NGTL System expired. Final tolls for 2013 were to be determined through either new settlements or rate cases and any orders resulting from the NEB's decision on the Canadian Restructuring
	Proposal.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We reached settlement of the NGTL System annual revenue requirement for the years 2013 and 2014 with shippers and other interested parties (the&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NGTL 2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2014
	Settlement
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). The settlement fixed the return on equity (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ROE
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) at 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on a 40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent deemed common equity, established an increase in the composite
	depreciation rate to 3.05&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent and 3.12&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent for 2013 and 2014, respectively, and fixed the operating, maintenance and administrative (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	OM&amp;A
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) costs for 2013 at
	$190&nbsp;million and 2014 at $198&nbsp;million with any variance to our account. We also requested and received approval for changes to existing interim rates to reflect the settlement, effective September&nbsp;1, 2013, pending a decision on the
	settlement application.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB approved the NGTL 2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2014 Settlement and final 2013 rates, as filed, in November&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We reached a revenue requirement settlement with our shippers for 2015 on the NGTL System. The terms of the one year settlement included no changes to the ROE of 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on 40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent deemed
	equity, a continuation of the 2014 depreciation rates and a mechanism for sharing variances above and below a fixed OM&amp;A expense amount. The settlement was filed with the NEB in October&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received NEB approval for our revenue requirement settlement with our shippers for 2015 on the NGTL System. The terms of the one year settlement include continuation of the 2014 ROE of 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on
	40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent deemed equity, continuation of the 2014 depreciation rates and a mechanism for sharing variances above and below a fixed OM&amp;A expense amount that is based on an escalation of 2014 actual costs.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Canadian Mainline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received NEB approval to build new pipeline facilities to provide Ontario and Qu&eacute;bec markets with additional gas supplies from the Marcellus shale basin.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The additional open season for firm transportation service on the Canadian Mainline, to bring additional Marcellus shale gas into Canada, closed. We were able to accommodate an additional 50&nbsp;MMcf/d from the Niagara
	meter station to Kirkwall, Ontario, effective November&nbsp;2012.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Transportation of natural gas supply from the Marcellus shale basin supply began moving on the Canadian Mainline.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Shippers on the Canadian Mainline elected to renew approximately 2.5&nbsp;Bcf/d of their contracts through November&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Tolls and Tariff Applications and LDC&nbsp;Settlement
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received the NEB decision on our Canadian Restructuring Proposal application to change the business structure and the terms and conditions of service for the Canadian Mainline. The NEB decision established a Toll
	Stabilization Account (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	TSA
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to capture the surplus or the shortfall between our revenues and our cost of service for each year over the five-year term of the decision. The NEB decision also identified
	certain circumstances that would require a new tolls application prior to the end of the five-year term. One of those circumstances is if the TSA balance becomes positive, which occurred in 2013.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a compliance filing and an application for a review and variance of the NEB decision regarding the Canadian Restructuring Proposal.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB dismissed the review and variance application and set out a process to consider the tariff revisions. Additional changes to the Canadian Mainline's tariff were considered by the NEB as a separate application which
	was heard in an oral hearing.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB released its reasons for the dismissal. We began implementation of the NEB decision related to the Canadian Restructuring Proposal. Since implementation, an additional 1.3&nbsp;Bcf/d of firm service originating at
	Empress, Alberta has been contracted for, more than doubling the contracted capacity of this location. The implementation of the NEB decision was a key priority in 2013 and with the ability to price discretionary services at market prices we were
	able to essentially meet our overall cost of service requirements for 2013.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Canadian Mainline and the three largest Canadian local distribution companies entered into a settlement (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	LDC Settlement
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) which was filed with the NEB for approval in
	December&nbsp;2013. The LDC Settlement proposed to establish new fixed tolls for 2015 to 2020 and maintain tolls for 2014 at the current rates. The LDC Settlement calculated tolls for 2015 on a base ROE of 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on
	40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent deemed common equity. It also included an incentive mechanism that requires a $20&nbsp;million (after tax) annual contribution by us from 2015 to 2020, which could result in a range of ROE outcomes from 8.70&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent
	to 11.50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent. The LDC Settlement would have enabled the addition of facilities in the Eastern Triangle to serve immediate market demand for supply diversity and market access. The LDC Settlement was intended to provide a market driven,
	stable, long-term accommodation of future demand in this region in combination with the anticipated lower demand for transportation on the Prairies Line and the Northern Ontario Line while providing a reasonable opportunity to recover our costs. The
	LDC Settlement also retained pricing flexibility for discretionary services and implemented certain tariff changes and new services as required by the terms of the settlement.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DF75605_1_7">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_6"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB responded to the LDC Settlement application we filed in December&nbsp;2013. The NEB did not approve the application as a settlement but allowed us the option to continue with the application as a contested tolls
	application, amend the application or terminate the processing of the application. We amended the application with additional information.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB released a Hearing Order that set out a hearing process and schedule for the 2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2030 Mainline Tolls and Tariff Application that incorporates the LDC Settlement. The hearing concluded in
	September 2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NEB approved the Canadian Mainline's 2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2030 Tolls and Tariff Application. The application reflected components of the LDC Settlement. The approval of this application provides a long-term
	commercial platform for both the Canadian Mainline and its shippers with a known toll design for 2015 to 2020 and certain parameters for a toll-setting methodology up to 2030. The platform balances the needs of our shippers while at the same time
	ensuring a reasonable opportunity to recover the capital from our existing facilities and any new facilities required to serve existing and new markets. Highlights of the approved application include our commitment to add increased pipeline capacity
	that allows eastern Canadian markets more access to Dawn and Niagara area supplies; renewal provisions that will give us the tools to gain more certainty over capacity requirements; fixed price tolls on one-year and longer firm transportation
	service; continued pricing discretion for shorter term and interruptible service; a known revenue requirement along with an incentive sharing mechanism that targets a return of 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on a deemed common equity of
	40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent, with a possible range of outcomes from 8.70&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent to 11.50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent; and the continued use of a deferral account that compensates for the differences between actual revenues and the fixed toll arrangement,
	plus an agreement that any overall variance in revenues for the 2015-2020 period is assigned to the eastern area shippers for the period beyond 2020.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Eastern Mainline Project
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a project description with the NEB for the Eastern Mainline Project.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed an application seeking NEB approval to build, own and operate new facilities for our existing Canadian Mainline natural gas transmission system in southeastern Ontario (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Eastern Mainline
	Project
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). The new facilities are a result of the proposed transfer of a portion of the Canadian Mainline capacity from natural gas service to crude oil service as part of our Energy East Pipeline and an open season that closed
	in January&nbsp;2014. The $1.5&nbsp;billion capital project will add 0.6&nbsp;Bcf/d of new capacity in the Eastern Triangle segment of the Canadian Mainline and will ensure appropriate levels of capacity are available to meet the requirements of
	existing shippers as well as new firm service commitments. The project is contingent upon the Energy East Pipeline and is subject to regulatory approvals expected to be issued simultaneously with regulatory approvals for the Energy East Pipeline. The
	project is expected to be in service by second quarter 2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Other Canadian Mainline Expansions
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In addition to the Eastern Mainline Project, we have executed new short haul arrangements in the Eastern Triangle portion of the Canadian Mainline that require new facilities, or modifications to existing facilities with
	a total capital cost estimate of $475&nbsp;million with expected in-service dates between November&nbsp;2015 and November&nbsp;2016. These projects are subject to regulatory approval and, once constructed, will provide capacity needed to meet
	customer requirements in eastern Canada.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	U.S. Pipelines
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Bison Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We sold an additional 45&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in each of Gas Transmission Northwest&nbsp;LLC (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	GTN
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) and Bison Pipeline&nbsp;LLC (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Bison
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	TCLP
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) for an aggregate purchase price of US$1.05&nbsp;billion. We continued to hold a 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent direct ownership
	interest in both pipelines.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We closed the sale of our remaining 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in Bison to TCLP for cash proceeds of US$215&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	GTN Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We sold an additional 45&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in each of GTN and Bison to TCLP for an aggregate purchase price of US$1.05&nbsp;billion. We continue to hold a 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent direct ownership interest in both
	pipelines.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced an offer to sell the remaining 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in GTN to TCLP. Subject to the satisfactory negotiation of terms and TCLP's board approval, the transaction is expected to close in late first
	quarter 2015. We continue to hold a 28.3&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in TCLP for which we are the General Partner.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ANR Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The FERC issued orders approving ANR's sale of its offshore assets to a newly created wholly owned subsidiary, TC&nbsp;Offshore&nbsp;LLC (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	TCO
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), allowing TCO to operate these
	assets as a stand alone interstate pipeline.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The FERC approved ANR Storage Company's settlement with its shippers.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TCO began commercial operations.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We concluded a successful binding open season. We have executed firm transportation contracts for 350&nbsp;MMcf/d at maximum tariff rates for 10&nbsp;years on the ANR Lebanon Lateral Reversal project, which will entail
	modifications to existing facilities. The project substantially increases our ability to receive gas on ANR's Southeast Main Line (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	SEML
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) from the Utica/Marcellus shale areas.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=16,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=495076,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DF75605A.;29',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DF75605_1_8">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	March 2014
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have secured nearly 2.0&nbsp;Bcf/d of firm natural gas transportation commitments for existing and expanded capacity on ANR Pipeline's SEML. The capacity sales and expansion projects include reversing the Lebanon
	Lateral in western Ohio, additional compression at Sulphur Springs, Indiana, expanding the Rockies Express pipeline interconnect near Shelbyville, Indiana and 600&nbsp;MMcf/d of capacity as part of a reversal project on the SEML. Capital costs
	associated with the ANR System expansions required to bring the additional capacity to market are currently estimated to be US$150&nbsp;million. The capacity was subscribed at maximum rates for an average term of 23&nbsp;years with approximately
	1.25&nbsp;Bcf/d of new contracts beginning service in late 2014. These secured contracts on the SEML will move Utica and Marcellus shale gas to points north and south on the system. ANR is also assessing further demand from our customers to transport
	natural gas from the Utica/Marcellus formation, which is expected to result in incremental opportunities to enhance and expand the system.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Greak Lakes
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Great Lakes received Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FERC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) approval for a rate settlement with its shippers resulting in maximum recourse rates increasing by
	approximately 21&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent resulting in a modest increase in revenues derived from its recourse rate contracts. The settlement includes a 17&nbsp;month moratorium through March&nbsp;2015 and requires us to have new rates in effect by
	January&nbsp;1, 2018.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Northern Border
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Northern Border secured a final settlement agreement with its shippers that the FERC approved in December&nbsp;2012, effective January&nbsp;2013. The settlement rates for long haul transportation are approximately
	11&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent lower than 2012 rates and depreciation was lowered from 2.4 to 2.2&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent. The settlement also includes a three year moratorium on filing cases or challenging the settlement rates but Northern Border must initiate
	another rate proceeding within five years.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Mexican Pipelines
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Tamazunchale Pipeline Extension Project
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February 2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We signed a contract with the Comisi&oacute;n Federal de Electricidad (Mexico) (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CFE
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) for the Tamazunchale Pipeline Extension project. Engineering, procurement and
	construction contracts were signed and construction related activities began.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Construction of the US$600&nbsp;million extension was completed. Delays from the original service commencement date in March&nbsp;2014 were attributed primarily to archeological findings along the pipeline route. Under
	the terms of the transportation service agreement, these delays were recognized as a force majeure with provisions allowing for collection of revenue from the original service commencement date.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Topolobampo and Mazatlan Pipeline Projects
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The CFE awarded us with the contract to build, own and operate the Topolobampo pipeline project. The Topolobampo project is a 530&nbsp;km (329&nbsp;miles), 30-inch pipeline with a capacity of 670&nbsp;MMcf/d and an
	estimated cost of US$1&nbsp;billion that will deliver gas to Topolobampo, Sinaloa from interconnects with third party pipelines in El Oro, Sinaloa and El Encino, Chihuahua in Mexico.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The CFE awarded us with the contract to build, own and operate the Mazatlan pipeline project from El Oro to Mazatlan, Mexico. The Mazatlan project is a 413&nbsp;km (257&nbsp;miles), 24-inch pipeline running from El Oro to
	Mazatlan, within the state of Sinaloa with a capacity of 200&nbsp;MMcf/d and an estimated cost of US$400&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Permitting, engineering, and construction activities are advancing as planned for these two northwest Mexico pipelines. Both projects are supported by 25-year contracts with the CFE and are expected to be in service mid
	to late 2016.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Guadalajara
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	First Quarter 2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The compressor station went into service.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Gas-Pacifico/INNERGY sale
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We closed the sale of our 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent equity interests in Gas Pacifico/INNERGY at a price of $9&nbsp;million. This sale marks our exit from the Southern Cone region of South America.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	LNG&nbsp;Pipeline Projects
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Coastal GasLink
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We were selected to design, build, own and operate the proposed Coastal GasLink. The 670&nbsp;km (416&nbsp;miles) pipeline is expected to have an initial capacity of 1.7&nbsp;Bcf/d and will transport natural gas from the
	Montney gas producing region near Dawson Creek, B.C. to LNG Canada's proposed LNG export facility near Kitimat, B.C.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed the Environmental Assessment Certificate (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	EAC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) application with the B.C. Environmental Assessment Office (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	EAO
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). We
	focused on community, landowner, government and Aboriginal engagement as the project advances through the regulatory process. The pipeline would be placed in service near the end of the decade, subject to a FID to be made by LNG Canada after
	obtaining final regulatory approvals. We continue to advance this project and all costs would be recoverable should the project not proceed.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=17,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=994479,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DF75605A.;29',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DF75605_1_9">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_8"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The 180-day EAO public review period began and included a 45-day public comment period. The B.C. Oil and Gas Commission (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	OGC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) application was filed, together with an addendum
	to the B.C. Environmental Assessment application to capture recent route refinements. We began updating field work along the pipeline route to support the regulatory applications and refine the capital cost estimates in the second
	quarter.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The EAO issued an EAC for Coastal GasLink. In 2014, we also submitted applications to the OGC for the permits required under the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Oil and Gas Activities Act
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to build and
	operate Coastal GasLink. Regulatory review of those applications is progressing on schedule, with permit decisions anticipated in first quarter 2015. We are currently continuing our engagement with Aboriginal groups and stakeholders along the
	pipeline route and are progressing detailed engineering and construction planning work to support the regulatory applications and refine the capital cost estimates. Pending the receipt of all required regulatory approvals and a positive FID from our
	customer, construction is anticipated in 2016, with an in-service date by the end of the decade. Should the project not proceed, our project costs (including AFUDC) are fully recoverable.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Prince Rupert Gas Transmission (PRGT)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We were selected to design, build, own and operate the proposed 750&nbsp;km (466&nbsp;miles) PRGT. The proposed pipeline will transport natural gas primarily from the North Montney gas producing region near Fort
	St&nbsp;John, B.C. to the proposed Pacific Northwest LNG export facility near Prince Rupert, B.C. We were focused on Aboriginal, community, landowner and government engagement as the PRGT advances through the regulatory process with the EAO. We
	continued to refine our study corridor based on consultation and detailed studies to date.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The EAC application was submitted to the EAO for a completeness review and the application was filed with the OGC. The EAC application was subsequently deemed complete by the EAO. The EAO initiated a 180-day review period
	which included a 45-day public comment period that was completed in July&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received an EAC from the EAO. We have submitted our pipeline permit applications to the OGC for construction of the pipeline and anticipate receiving these permits in first quarter 2015. We have made significant
	changes to the project route since first announced, increasing it by 150&nbsp;km (93&nbsp;miles) to 900&nbsp;km (559&nbsp;miles), taking into account Aboriginal and stakeholder input. We continue to work closely with Aboriginal groups and
	stakeholders along the proposed route to create and deliver appropriate benefits to all impacted groups. We concluded a benefits agreement with the Nisga' a First Nation to allow 85&nbsp;km (52&nbsp;miles) of the proposed natural gas pipeline to run
	through Nisga'a Lands.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our customer announced the deferral of an FID. We continue to work with our contractors to refine capital cost estimates for the project. Once the permitting process with the OGC is complete, and Pacific NorthWest LNG
	secures the necessary regulatory approvals and proceeds with a positive FID, we will be in a position to begin construction. All costs would be fully recoverable should the project not proceed. The deferral of an FID past the end of 2014 has resulted
	in a deferral of the expected in-service date for the pipeline. The in-service date will depend on when our customer receives the necessary regulatory approvals and is in a position to make an FID.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Alaska
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Three major North Slope producers (the&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ANS Producers
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), along with us through participation in the Alaska LNG Project, announced agreement on a work plan aimed at
	commercializing North Slope natural gas resources through an LNG option.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received approval from the State of Alaska to suspend and preserve our activities on the Alaska/Alberta route and focus on the LNG alternative. This allowed us to defer our obligation to file for a U.S.&nbsp;FERC
	certificate for the Alberta route beyond fall 2012, our original deadline.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Alaska LNG Project announced a non-binding public solicitation of interest in securing capacity on a potential new pipeline system to transport Alaska's North Slope gas. The solicitation of interest took place between
	August&nbsp;2012 and September&nbsp;2012. There were a number of non-binding expressions of interest from potential shippers from a broad range of industry sectors in North America and Asia.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The State of Alaska passed new legislation to provide a framework for us, the ANS Producers, and the Alaska Gasline Development Corp. (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	AGDC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to advance the development of an
	LNG export project.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We executed an agreement with the State of Alaska to abandon the previous Alaska to Alberta project governance and framework and executed a new precedent agreement where we will act as the transporter of the State's
	portion of natural gas under a long-term shipping contract in the Alaska LNG Project. We also entered into a Joint Venture Agreement with the three major ANS Producers and AGDC to commence the pre-front end engineering and design (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	pre-FEED
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) phase of Alaska LNG Project. The pre-FEED work is anticipated to take two years to complete with our share of the cost to be approximately US$100&nbsp;million. The precedent agreement also provides us with
	full recovery of development costs in the event the project does not proceed.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The ANS Producers filed an export permit application with the U.S.&nbsp;Department of Energy for the right to export 20&nbsp;million tonnes per annum of liquefied natural gas for 30&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The FERC approved the National Environmental Policy Act (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NEPA
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) pre-file request jointly made by us, the three major ANS Producers and AGDC. This approval triggers the NEPA
	environmental review process, which includes a series of community consultations.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
