<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=18,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=299281,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DF75605A.;29',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_10">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DEVELOPMENTS IN THE LIQUIDS PIPELINES BUSINESS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Keystone Pipeline System
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that what had previously been the Cushing to U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast section of the Keystone Pipeline System has its own independent value to the marketplace, and that we plan to build it as a stand alone
	pipeline which is not part of the Keystone&nbsp;XL Presidential Permit application.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed revised fixed tolls for the second section of the Keystone Pipeline System extending from Steele City, Nebraska to Cushing, Oklahoma, with both the NEB and the FERC. The revised tolls, which reflect the final
	project costs of the Keystone Pipeline System, became effective in July&nbsp;2012.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We finished constructing the 780&nbsp;km (485&nbsp;miles) 36-inch pipeline of the Gulf Coast extension of the Keystone Pipeline System from Cushing, Oklahoma to the U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast, and crude oil transportation
	service on the project began. We projected an average pipeline capacity of 520,000&nbsp;Bbl/d for the first year of operation. The completion of the Gulf Coast extension in January&nbsp;2014 expanded the Keystone Pipeline System to a 4,247&nbsp;km
	(2,639&nbsp;miles) pipeline system that transports crude oil from Hardisty, Alberta, to markets in the U.S.&nbsp;Midwest and the U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast. To date, the Keystone Pipeline System has delivered more than 830&nbsp;million barrels of crude oil
	from Canada to the U.S.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Cushing Marketlink
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We commenced construction on the Cushing Marketlink facilities which will facilitate the transportation of crude oil from the market hub at Cushing to the U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast refining market on facilities that form part
	of the Keystone Pipeline System.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Construction was completed.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Houston Lateral and Terminal
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Construction continues on the 77&nbsp;km (48&nbsp;miles) Houston Lateral pipeline and tank terminal which will extend the Keystone Pipeline System to Houston, Texas refineries. The terminal is expected to have initial
	storage capacity for 700,000&nbsp;barrels of crude oil. The pipeline and terminal are expected to be completed in the second half of 2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Keystone&nbsp;XL
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We sent a letter to the U.S.&nbsp;Department of State (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DOS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) informing the DOS that we planned to file&nbsp;a Presidential Permit application in the near future for
	Keystone&nbsp;XL. We also informed the DOS that the Cushing to U.S.&nbsp;Gulf Coast portion of Keystone&nbsp;XL would be constructed outside of the Presidential Permit process.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a Presidential Permit application (cross-border permit) with the DOS for Keystone&nbsp;XL to transport crude oil from the U.S./Canada border in Montana to Steele City, Nebraska. We continued to work with the
	Nebraska Department of Environmental Quality (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NDEQ
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) and various other stakeholders throughout 2012 to determine an alternative route in Nebraska that would avoid the Nebraska Sandhills. We proposed an
	alternative route to the NDEQ in April&nbsp;2012, and then modified the route in response to comments from the NDEQ and other stakeholders.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We submitted a Supplemental Environmental Report to the NDEQ for the proposed reroute for Keystone&nbsp;XL in Nebraska, and provided an environmental report to the DOS, required as part of the DOS review of our
	cross-border permit application.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The NDEQ issued its final evaluation report on our proposed reroute of Keystone&nbsp;XL to the Governor of Nebraska. In January&nbsp;2013, the Governor of Nebraska approved our proposed reroute. The NDEQ issued its final
	evaluation report noting that construction and operation of Keystone&nbsp;XL is expected to have minimal environmental impacts in Nebraska.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The DOS released its Draft Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement for Keystone&nbsp;XL. The impact statement reaffirmed construction of the 830,000&nbsp;Bbl/d Keystone&nbsp;XL project would not result in any
	significant impact to the environment.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The DOS released its Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FSEIS
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) for the Keystone&nbsp;XL project. The results included in the report were consistent with
	previous environmental reviews of Keystone&nbsp;XL. The FSEIS concluded Keystone&nbsp;XL is unlikely to significantly impact the rate of extraction in the oil sands and that all other alternatives to Keystone&nbsp;XL are less efficient methods of
	transporting crude oil, and would result in significantly more greenhouse gas (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	GHG
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) emissions, oil spills and risks to public safety. The report initiated the National Interest Determination period of up
	to 90&nbsp;days which involves consultation with other governmental agencies and provides an opportunity for public comment.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A Nebraska district court ruled that the state Public Service Commission, rather than Governor Dave Heineman, has the authority to approve an alternative route through Nebraska for Keystone&nbsp;XL.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The DOS announced that the national interest determination period has been extended indefinitely to allow them to consider the potential impact of the Nebraska portion of the pipeline route.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Nebraska's Attorney General filed an appeal which was heard by the Nebraska State Supreme Court. We filed a certification petition for Keystone&nbsp;XL with the South Dakota Public Utilities Commission (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PUC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	). This certification confirms that the conditions under which Keystone&nbsp;XL's original June&nbsp;2010 PUC construction permit was granted continue to be satisfied. The formal hearing for the certification is
	scheduled for May&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=19,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=998177,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_11">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_10"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Nebraska State Supreme Court vacated the lower court's ruling that the law was unconstitutional. As a result, the Governor's January&nbsp;2013 approval of the alternate route through Nebraska for Keystone&nbsp;XL
	remains valid. Landowners have filed lawsuits in two Nebraska counties seeking to enjoin Keystone&nbsp;XL from condemning easements on state constitutional grounds.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The DOS reinitiated the national interest review and requested the eight federal agencies, with a role in the review, to complete their consideration of whether Keystone&nbsp;XL serves the national interest and to provide
	their views to the DOS by February&nbsp;2, 2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February 2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The U.S.&nbsp;Environmental Protection Agency (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	EPA
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) posted a comment letter to its website suggesting that, among other things, the FSEIS issued by the DOS has not fully and
	completely assessed the environmental impacts of Keystone XL and that, at lower oil prices, Keystone XL may increase the rates of oil sands production and greenhouse gas emissions. We sent a letter to the DOS refuting these and other comments in the
	EPA letter but also offering to work with the DOS to ensure it has all the relevant information to allow it to reach a decision to approve Keystone XL. The timing and ultimate approval of Keystone XL remain uncertain. In the event the project does
	not proceed as planned, we would reassess and reduce its carrying value to its recoverable amount if necessary and appropriate. The estimated capital costs for Keystone&nbsp;XL are expected to be approximately US$8.0&nbsp;billion. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, we had invested US$2.4&nbsp;billion in the project and have also capitalized interest in the amount of $0.4&nbsp;billion.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Keystone Hardisty Terminal
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March 2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We launched and concluded a binding open season to obtain commitments from interested parties for the Keystone Hardisty Terminal.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May 2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that we had secured binding long-term commitments of more than 500,000&nbsp;Bbl/d for the Keystone Hardisty Terminal, and are expanding the proposed two million barrel project to a 2.6&nbsp;million barrel
	terminal at Hardisty, Alberta, due to strong commercial support.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Keystone Hardisty Terminal will be constructed in conjunction with Keystone&nbsp;XL and is expected to be completed approximately two years from the date the Keystone&nbsp;XL permit is received.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Energy East Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that we were holding an open season to obtain firm commitments for a pipeline to transport crude oil from western receipt points to eastern Canadian markets. The open season followed a successful expression
	of interest phase and discussions with prospective shippers.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that we were moving forward with the 1.1&nbsp;million Bbl/d Energy East Pipeline as it received approximately 900,000&nbsp;Bbl/d of firm, long-term contracts in its open season to transport crude oil from
	western Canada to eastern refineries and export terminals. The project is estimated to cost approximately $12&nbsp;billion, excluding the transfer value of Canadian Mainline natural gas assets. We began Aboriginal and stakeholder engagement and
	associated field work as part of our initial design and planning.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed the project description for the Energy East Pipeline with the NEB. This was the first formal step in the regulatory process to receive the necessary approvals to build and operate the pipeline.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed the necessary regulatory applications for approvals to construct and operate the Energy East Pipeline and terminal facilities with the NEB. The project is estimated to cost approximately $12&nbsp;billion,
	excluding the transfer value of Canadian Mainline natural gas assets. Subject to regulatory approvals, the pipeline is anticipated to commence deliveries by the end of 2018.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Energy East Pipeline includes a proposed marine terminal near Cacouna, Qu&eacute;bec which would be adjacent to a beluga whale habitat. The Committee on the Status of Endangered Wildlife in Canada recommended that
	beluga whales be placed on the endangered species list. As a result, we have made the decision to halt any further work at Cacouna and will be analyzing the recommendation, assessing any impacts to the project and reviewing all viable options. We
	intend to make a decision on how to proceed by the end of first quarter 2015. The 1.1&nbsp;million Bbl/d Energy East Pipeline received approximately one&nbsp;million Bbl/d of firm, long-term contracts to transport crude oil from western Canada that
	were secured during binding open seasons.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Northern Courier Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that we were selected by Fort Hills Energy Limited Partnership (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FHELP
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to design, build, own and operate the proposed Northern Courier Pipeline. The pipeline
	system is fully subscribed under a long-term contract to service the Fort Hills mine, which is jointly owned by Suncor Energy&nbsp;Inc. (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Suncor
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) and two other companies.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a permit application with the Alberta Energy Regulator (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	AER
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) after completing the required Aboriginal and stakeholder engagement and associated field
	work.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Suncor announced that the FHELP was proceeding with the Fort Hills oil sands mining project and that it expected to begin producing crude oil in 2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="17%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The AER issued a permit approving our application to construct and operate the Northern Courier Pipeline. Construction has started on the $900&nbsp;million, 90&nbsp;km (56&nbsp;miles) pipeline to transport bitumen and
	diluent between the Fort Hills mine site and Suncor's terminal located north of Fort McMurray, Alberta. We currently expect the pipeline to be ready for service in&nbsp;2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=20,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=538667,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_12">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Heartland Pipeline and TC Terminals
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced we had reached binding long-term shipping agreements to build, own and operate the Heartland Pipeline and TC Terminals projects, and filed a permit application for the terminal facility.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a permit application for the pipeline with the AER after completing the required Aboriginal and stakeholder engagement and associated field work.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The application for the terminal facility was approved by the AER.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Construction commenced on the terminal. The Heartland Pipeline is a 200&nbsp;km (125&nbsp;miles) crude oil pipeline connecting the Edmonton/Heartland, Alberta market region to facilities in Hardisty, Alberta. TC Terminals
	is a terminal facility in the Heartland industrial area north of Edmonton, Alberta. The pipeline could transport up to 900,000&nbsp;Bbl/d, while the terminal is expected to have initial storage capacity for up to 1.9&nbsp;million barrels of crude
	oil. These projects together have a combined estimated cost of $900&nbsp;million and are expected to be placed in service in late&nbsp;2017.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Grand Rapids Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced that we had entered into binding agreements with a partner to develop the Grand Rapids Pipeline, a 460&nbsp;km (287&nbsp;miles) crude oil and diluent pipeline system connecting the producing area northwest of
	Fort McMurray, Alberta to terminals in the Edmonton/Heartland, Alberta region. Our partner has also entered into a long-term transportation service contract in support of the Grand Rapids Pipeline. Along with our partner, we will each own
	50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the project and we will operate the system.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We filed a permit application for the Grand Rapids Pipeline with the AER after completing the required Aboriginal and stakeholder engagement and associated field work.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The AER issued a permit approving our application to construct and operate the Grand Rapids Pipeline. Construction has commenced with initial crude oil transportation planned in&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Upland Pipeline
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We completed a successful binding open season for the Upland Pipeline. The $600&nbsp;million pipeline would provide crude oil transportation from, and between multiple points in North Dakota and interconnect with the
	Energy East Pipeline System at Moosomin, Saskatchewan. Subject to regulatory approvals, we anticipate the Upland Pipeline to be in service in 2018. The commercial contracts we have executed for Upland Pipeline are conditioned on Energy East
	proceeding.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Further information about developments in the Liquids Pipelines business can be found in the MD&amp;A in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	About our
	business&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Strategy, Liquids Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Results, Liquids Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Outlook, Liquids
	Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Understanding the Liquids Pipelines business
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Liquids
	Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Significant Events
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	sections, which sections of the MD&amp;A are incorporated by reference herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	12&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual information form
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>

<EFX_GENERAL_DEVELOPMENT_OF_THE_COMPANY>
<A NAME="FIS_GENERAL_DEVELOPMENT_OF_THE_COMPANY"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DEVELOPMENTS IN THE ENERGY BUSINESS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Canadian Power
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Ontario Solar
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We completed the acquisition of the first facility for $55&nbsp;million as per our December&nbsp;2011 agreement, pursuant to which we agreed to buy nine Ontario solar generation facilities (combined capacity of
	86&nbsp;megawatts (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	MW
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	)) from Canadian Solar Solutions&nbsp;Inc. (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Canadian Solar
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	), for approximately $500&nbsp;million. Under the terms of the agreement,
	Canadian Solar will develop and build each of the nine solar facilities using photovoltaic panels. We buy each facility once construction and acceptance testing are complete and commercial operation begins. All power produced by the solar facilities
	is currently or will be sold under 20-year Feed-in Tariff (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FIT
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) contracts with the IESO.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We completed the acquisition of two additional solar facilities for $99&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We completed the acquisition of an additional solar facility for $62&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We completed the acquisition of three additional solar facilities for $181&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We acquired an additional solar facility for $60&nbsp;million. Our total investment in the eight solar facilities is $457&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Napanee
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We signed a contract with the Ontario Power Authority (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	OPA
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to develop, own and operate a new 900&nbsp;MW natural gas-fired power plant at Ontario Power Generation's Lennox
	site in eastern Ontario in the town of Greater Napanee.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We began construction activities on the power plant. We expect to invest approximately $1.0&nbsp;billion in the Napanee facility during construction and commercial operations are expected to begin in late 2017 or early
	2018. Production from the facility is fully contracted with the Independent Electricity System Operator (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	IESO
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B&eacute;cancour
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec Distribution (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) notified us that it would exercise its option to extend the agreement to suspend all electricity generation from the
	B&eacute;cancour power plant through 2013. Under the original agreement, Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec had the option to extend the suspension on an annual basis until such time as regional electricity demand levels recover.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec notified us that it would exercise its option to extend the agreement to suspend all electricity generation from the B&eacute;cancour power plant through 2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We entered into an amendment to the original suspension agreement with Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec to further extend suspension of generation through to the end of 2017. Under the amendment, Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec continues to have
	the option (subject to certain conditions) to further extend the suspension past 2017. The amendment also includes revised provisions intended to reduce Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec's payments to us for B&eacute;cancour's natural gas transportation costs
	during the suspension period, although we retain our ability to recover our full capacity costs under the Electricity Supply Contract with Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec while the facility is suspended.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We received final approval from the R&eacute;gie de l'&eacute;nergie for the December&nbsp;2013 amendment to the original suspension agreement with Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec. In addition, Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec exercised its
	option in the amended suspension agreement to extend suspension of all electricity generation to the end of 2017, and requested further suspension of generation to the end of 2018. We continue to receive capacity payments while generation is
	suspended.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Cancarb Limited and Cancarb Waste Heat Facility
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We announced we had reached an agreement for the sale of Cancarb Limited, our thermal carbon black facility, and its related power generation facility.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The sale of Cancarb Limited and its related power generation facility, closed for gross proceeds of $190&nbsp;million. We recognized a gain of $99&nbsp;million, net of tax, in second quarter 2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Bruce Power
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce Power received authorization from the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission to power up the Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;2&nbsp;reactor.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	An incident occurred within the Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;2&nbsp;electrical generator on the non-nuclear side of the plant which delayed the synchronization of Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;2 to the Ontario electrical grid. As a
	result, Bruce Power submitted a force majeure claim to the OPA.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce Power returned Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;3 to service after completing the $300&nbsp;million West Shift Plus life extension outage, which began in 2011.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	August&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We confirmed that Bruce Power's force majeure claim to the OPA related to the Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;2 had been accepted. With the acceptance of the force majeure claim, Bruce Power continued to receive the contracted
	price for power generated from the operating units at Bruce&nbsp;A after July&nbsp;1, 2012.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_14">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce&nbsp;A Units&nbsp;1 and 2&nbsp;were returned to service following the completion of their refurbishment.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Both Bruce&nbsp;A Units&nbsp;1 and 2&nbsp;have operated at reduced output levels following their return to service, and Bruce Power took Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;1&nbsp;offline for an approximate one month maintenance
	outage.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce Power announced that it had reached an agreement with the OPA to extend the Bruce&nbsp;B floor price through to the end of the decade, which is expected to coincide with the 2019 and 2020 end of life dates for the
	Bruce&nbsp;B units.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce Power returned Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;4 to service after completing an expanded life extension outage investment program, which began in August&nbsp;2012. It is anticipated that this investment will allow
	Bruce&nbsp;A Unit&nbsp;4 to operate until at least 2021.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cameco Corporation sold its 31.6&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent limited partnership interest in Bruce&nbsp;B to BPC&nbsp;Generation Infrastructure Trust. We are considering our option to increase our Bruce&nbsp;B ownership
	percentage.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	New&nbsp;Canadian federal legislation is expected to come into force in 2015 respecting the determination of liability and compensation for a nuclear incident in Canada resulting in personal injuries and damages. This
	proposed legislation will replace existing legislation which currently provides that the licensed operator of a nuclear facility has absolute and exclusive liability and limits the liability to a maximum of $75&nbsp;million. The proposed new law is
	fundamentally consistent with the existing regime although the maximum liability will increase to $650&nbsp;million and increase in increments over three years to a maximum of $1&nbsp;billion. The operator will also be required to maintain financial
	assurances such as insurance in the amount of the maximum liability. Our indirect subsidiary owns one&nbsp;third of the common shares of Bruce Power&nbsp;Inc., the licensed operator of Bruce Power, and as such Bruce Power&nbsp;Inc. is subject to this
	liability in the event of an incident as well as the legislation's other requirements.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Sundance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	July&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	An arbitration panel decided that the Sundance A PPA should not be terminated and ordered the operator to rebuild Units&nbsp;1 and 2. The panel also limited the operator's force majeure claim from November&nbsp;20, 2011
	until the units could reasonably be returned to service. The operator announced that it expected the units to be returned to service in the fall of 2013. Since we considered the outages to be an interruption of supply, we accrued $188&nbsp;million in
	pretax income between December&nbsp;2010 and March&nbsp;2012. The outcome of the decision was that we received approximately $138&nbsp;million of this amount. We recorded the $50&nbsp;million difference as a pre-tax charge to second quarter 2012
	earnings, of which $20&nbsp;million related to amounts accrued in 2011. We did not record further revenue or costs from the PPA until the units were returned to service.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	An arbitration decision was reached with the arbitration panel granting partial force majeure relief to the operator with respect to Sundance B Unit&nbsp;3, and we reduced our equity earnings by $11&nbsp;million from the
	ASTC&nbsp;Power Partnership (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ASTC
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) to reflect the amount that will not be recovered as result of the decision. In 2010, Sundance B Unit&nbsp;3&nbsp;experienced an unplanned outage related to mechanical
	failure of certain generator components and was subject to a force majeure claim by the operator. The ASTC, which holds the Sundance B PPA, disputed the claim under the binding dispute resolution process provided in the PPA because we did not believe
	the operator's claim met the test of force majeure. We therefore recorded equity earnings from our 50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent ownership interest in ASTC as though this event were a normal plant outage.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Sundance A Unit&nbsp;1&nbsp;returned to service.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	October&nbsp;2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Sundance A Unit&nbsp;2&nbsp;returned to service.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Cartier Wind
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	November&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We placed the second phase of the Gros-Morne wind farm project in service, completing the 590&nbsp;MW, five phase Cartier Wind Project in Qu&eacute;bec. All of the power produced by Cartier Wind is sold to
	Hydro-Qu&eacute;bec under 20-year PPAs.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CrossAlta
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We acquired the remaining 40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interests in the Crossfield Gas Storage facility and CrossAlta Gas Storage&nbsp;&amp; Services&nbsp;Ltd. (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CrossAlta
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) marketing
	company from our partner for approximately $214&nbsp;million cash, net of cash acquired. We now own and operate 100&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the interests of CrossAlta. The acquisition added an additional 27&nbsp;billion cubic&nbsp;feet (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Bcf
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) of working gas storage capacity to our existing portfolio in Alberta.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	U.S. Power
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Ravenswood
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The 972&nbsp;MW Unit&nbsp;30&nbsp;at the Ravenswood Generating Station experienced an unplanned outage as a result of a problem with the generator associated with the high pressure turbine. Insurance is expected to cover
	the repair costs and lost revenues associated with the unplanned outage, which are yet to be finalized. As a result of the expected insurance recoveries, net of deductibles, the Unit&nbsp;30&nbsp;unplanned outage is not expected to have a significant
	impact on our earnings, although the recording of earnings may not coincide with lost revenues due to timing of the anticipated insurance proceeds. The unit is expected to be back in service in first half 2015.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	New&nbsp;York power business
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="18%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	June&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2011, spot prices for capacity sales in the New&nbsp;York Zone J Market were negatively impacted by the manner in which the New&nbsp;York Independent System Operator (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NYISO
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) applied pricing rules for a power plant that had recently began service in this market. We jointly filed two formal complaints with the FERC challenging how the NYISO applied its buy-side mitigation rules affecting bidding criteria
	associated with two new power plants that began service in the New&nbsp;York Zone J markets during the summer of 2011. In June&nbsp;2012, the FERC addressed the first complaint, indicating it would take steps to increase transparency and
	accountability for future mitigation exemption tests (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	MET
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) and decisions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=23,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=460353,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_15">
</A>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="16%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_12"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Description of development
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	September&nbsp;2012
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The FERC granted an order on the second complaint, directing the NYISO to retest the two new power plants as well as a transmission project currently under construction using an amended set of assumptions to more
	accurately perform the MET calculations, in accordance with existing rules and tariff provisions. The recalculation was completed in November&nbsp;2012 and it was determined that one of the plants not owned by us had been granted an exemption in
	error. That exemption was revoked and the plant is now required to offer its capacity at a floor price which put upward pressure on capacity auction prices since December&nbsp;2012. The order was prospective only and has no impact on capacity prices
	for prior periods.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	January&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Capacity prices in the New&nbsp;York market are established through a series of forward auctions and utilize a demand curve administered price for purposes of setting the monthly spot price. The demand curve, among other
	inputs, uses assumptions with respect to the expected cost of the most likely peaking generation technology applicable to new entrants to the market. In January&nbsp;2014, the FERC accepted a new rate for the demand curve that was filed by NYISO as
	part of its triennial Demand Curve Reset (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DCR
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) process. The filing changed the generation technology used in the DCR versus that used during the last reset process for New&nbsp;York City Zone J where
	Ravenswood operates. This new assumption has the potential to negatively affect Zone&nbsp;J capacity prices in 2015 and 2016. Additionally, another recent FERC decision affecting future capacity auctions in New&nbsp;England Power Pool (
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NEPOOL
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	) may potentially improve capacity price conditions in 2018 and beyond for our assets that are located in NEPOOL.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fourth Quarter 2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Average New&nbsp;York Zone J spot capacity prices were approximately 27&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent higher in 2014 than in 2013. The increase in spot prices and the impact of hedging activities resulted in higher realized capacity
	prices in New&nbsp;York in 2014.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Natural Gas Storage
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="16%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	April&nbsp;2014
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="82%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We terminated a 38&nbsp;Bcf long-term natural gas storage contract in Alberta with Niska Gas Storage. The contract contained provisions allowing for possible early termination. As a result, we recorded an after tax charge
	of $32&nbsp;million in 2014. We have re-contracted for new natural gas storage services in Alberta with Niska Gas Storage starting May&nbsp;1, 2014 for a six-year period and a reduced average volume.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>

</FONT>

<I>
	About our
	business&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Strategy, Energy&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Results, Energy&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Outlook,
	Energy&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Understanding the Energy business
</I>

</FONT>

	Events

	sections, which sections of the MD&amp;A are incorporated by reference herein.

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=24,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=834532,FOLIO='15',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_16">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=4>
	Business of TransCanada
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are a leading North American energy infrastructure company focused on Natural Gas Pipelines, Liquids Pipelines and Energy. At Year End and for the year then
	ended, Natural Gas Pipelines accounted for approximately 48&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of revenues and 46&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of our total assets, Liquids Pipelines accounted for approximately
	15&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of revenues and 27&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of our total assets' and Energy accounted for approximately 37&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of revenues and 24&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of
	our total assets. The following table shows our revenues from operations by segment, classified geographically, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="87%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=6 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenues from operations
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(millions of dollars)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2014
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2013
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Exports
	include pipeline revenues attributable to Canadian Pipeline and power deliveries to U.S.&nbsp;markets.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Revenues
	include sales of natural gas.
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Revenues
	are attributed to countries based on country of origin of product or&nbsp;service.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following is a description of each of TransCanada's three main areas of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	16&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=25,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=711092,FOLIO='16',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NATURAL GAS PIPELINES BUSINESS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our natural gas pipeline network transports natural gas to local distribution companies,
	power generation facilities and other businesses across Canada, the U.S. and Mexico. We
	also have regulated natural gas storage facilities in&nbsp;Michigan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	are the operator of all of the following natural gas pipelines and regulated natural gas storage assets except for&nbsp;Iroquois.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="90%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<B>
	length
</B>
</FONT>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	NGTL System
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	24,525&nbsp;km
<BR>
	(15,239&nbsp;miles)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Receives, transports and delivers natural gas within Alberta and B.C., and connects with the Canadian Mainline, Foothills system and third-party pipelines
</FONT>
</TD>

	100%
</FONT>
</TD>

</TD>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="21%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Canadian Mainline
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">

<TD WIDTH="11%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=27,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=952737,FOLIO='18',FILE='DISK128:[14ZDF5.14ZDF75605]DG75605A.;51',USER='RMCIVOR',CD='13-FEB-2015;10:32' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75605_1_19">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	LIQUIDS PIPELINES BUSINESS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our existing liquids pipeline infrastructure connects Alberta and U.S. crude oil
	supplies to U.S.&nbsp;refining markets in Illinois, Oklahoma and Texas, as well as connecting
	U.S.&nbsp;crude oil supplies from the Cushing, Oklahoma hub to refining markets in the U.S.&nbsp;Gulf&nbsp;Coast. Our proposed future pipeline infrastructure would also connect Canadian and U.S.
	crude oil supplies to refining markets in eastern Canada and overseas export markets, expand Canadian and U.S.&nbsp;crude oil to U.S.&nbsp;markets and connect condensate supplies to U.S. and
	Canadian markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	are the operator of all of the following pipelines and properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

</TD>

	Further information about our pipeline holdings, developments and opportunities and significant regulatory developments which relate to Liquids Pipelines can be
	found in the MD&amp;A in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Liquids Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Results, Liquids Pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Understanding the Liquids
	Pipelines business
</I>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

	sections, which sections of
	the MD&amp;A are incorporated by reference herein.

	TransCanada
