<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=72,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=549855,FOLIO='',FILE="DISK133:[14ZDF6.14ZDF75616]26156-16-DC_ZDF75616.CHC",USER="RMCIVOR",CD='FEB 13 07:20 2015' -->
<A NAME="eolPage18"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_53"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100.0%;">
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID;">
<TD WIDTH="92%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:92.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;">
<IMG WIDTH="680" HEIGHT="885" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G2615616DCI018.GIF">
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:4.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	TransCanada
	2014 17 We are developing an enviable position in the liquid hydrocarbon
	transportation business as we move forward with our strategy of connecting
	key producing areas in Canada and the United States to domestic and
	international refinery markets. Our Keystone Pipeline System is proving to be
	a valuable platform for growth, while our experience in repurposing
	underutilized natural gas pipeline facilities is helping to meet the growing
	need for crude oil transportation across the continent. EBITDA Surpasses $1
	Billion Keystone has safely transported more than 830 million barrels of
	crude oil from Canada to U.S. markets since it began operation in July 2010.
	With the completion of the Gulf Coast extension in January 2014, the system
	now provides a direct route for our shippers from Hardisty, Alberta to Gulf
	Coast refineries at Port Arthur, Texas. This resulted in the EBITDA
	contribution from Keystone surpassing $1 billion in 2014. Our Keystone
	Pipeline System will extend its market reach even further in 2015 with the
	completion of the Houston Lateral and Terminal project. Our history of
	operating natural gas and liquids pipelines in Alberta has been instrumental
	in capturing $3.6 billion in new investments to move growing crude oil
	production within the province. These projects will serve as an excellent
	base for our shippers to access various crude oil markets via Keystone and
	our proposed Keystone XL and Energy East projects. Construction commenced in
	the second half of 2014 on both the $1.5-billion Grand Rapids Pipeline and on
	the $900-million Northern Courier Pipeline following approval of both
	projects by the Alberta Energy Regulator. Committed to Keystone XL
	TransCanada and our shippers remain committed to Keystone XL despite the
	unprecedented delays we have faced on this much-needed project. We are
	pleased that the Final Supplemental Environmental Impact Statement issued by
	the Department of State at the end of January 2014 reinforced previous
	conclusions that Keystone XL will be built and operated with minimal impact
	on the environment. The report also reiterated the benefits of the project,
	noting that Keystone XL will enhance American energy security, create more
	than 40,000 jobs and generate billions of dollars in economic activity for
	the U.S. The Nebraska Supreme Court&#146;s decision in early 2015 validated the
	pipeline&#146;s route in the state, allowing the Department of State to complete
	its National Interest Determination process. We expect Keystone XL to begin
	service approximately two years after receiving a Presidential Permit that
	will allow the pipeline to cross the Canada-U.S. border. Energy East Moves
	Forward Our $12-billion Energy East Pipeline project has secured long-term
	take-or-pay contracts to ship approximately one million barrels per day of
	crude oil from western Canada to refineries and proposed marine terminals in
	eastern Canada. This innovative project that will repurpose more than 3,000
	km of underutilized capacity on the Canadian Mainline continues to gain
	public support as Canadians recognize the benefits of enhancing market access
	for our valuable energy resources and eliminating eastern Canada&#146;s reliance
	on imported crude oil. We filed an extensive application for the Energy East
	Pipeline project with the NEB at the end of October. Subject to regulatory
	approvals, we anticipate crude oil deliveries to begin by the end of 2018.
	Altogether, our list of commercially secured projects will transform the
	company. In addition to smaller-scale projects, bringing Keystone XL and
	Energy East to fruition will provide us with approximately 2.5 million
	barrels per day of long-haul capacity underpinned by approximately two
	million barrels per day of long-term contracts, establishing us as leaders in
	the transportation of liquid hydrocarbons. Construction is underway on the US$600
	million Houston Lateral and Terminal project in Texas, employing members of
	local tribes to monitor for unanticipated sites of cultural significance.
	Listening to communities: The application for the Energy East Pipeline
	project reflected the input of thousands of landowners, Aboriginal groups and
	community members across six provinces. The Gulf Coast extension of the
	Keystone System provides a direct route for our shippers from Hardisty,
	Alberta to U.S. Gulf Coast refineries at Port Arthur, Texas. large photo: The
	hub of TransCanada&#146;s liquids network is the Hardisty terminal in Alberta.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	18 TransCanada
	2014 11MMhomes TRANSCANADA OWNS OR HAS INTEREST IN 10,900 MEGAWATTS OF
	ELECTRICITY GENERATION ACROSS NORTH AMERICA, ENOUGH TO POWER APPROXIMATELY 11
	MILLION HOMES. Our Energy business performed well in 2014, generating more
	than $1.3 billion in EBITDA thanks to the strong performance of the Bruce
	Nuclear facility in Ontario and our U.S.-based fleet of power generation
	facilities. energy We have critical mass in our core North American power

<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_55"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100.0%;">
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID;">
<TD WIDTH="92%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:92.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;">
<IMG WIDTH="680" HEIGHT="886" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G2615616DCI020.GIF">
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:4.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	TransCanada
	2014 19 We are Canada&#146;s largest private sector power company, with interests
	in 10,900 MW of generating capacity, one-third of which comes from
	emission-less sources including nuclear, hydro, wind and solar. Our diverse
	portfolio of assets is comprised of 19 power generation facilities that are
	either underpinned by long-term contracts, are on the low end of the cost curve,
	or are otherwise supported by stable revenue streams. With facilities located
	in Alberta, eastern Canada, New England, Arizona and New York, our focus on
	maximizing earnings from this critical infrastructure is relentless. Our
	experience in these regions positions us well for the future, as new
	opportunities arise to keep pace with demand growth in these markets through
	the replacement of older facilities with new, less carbon-intense forms of
	electricity generation. Strong Performance Our Energy business performed well
	in 2014, generating more than $1.3 billion in EBITDA. Strong performance of
	the Bruce Nuclear facility in Ontario, where all eight reactors are in
	operation and providing approximately one-third of the province&#146;s power
	supply, was coupled with similarly strong performance from our U.S.-based
	fleet. We also expanded our portfolio of renewable energy sources with four
	additional solar generation facilities in Ontario. The $1-billion Napanee
	Generating Station under development in Ontario obtained necessary permits
	for construction to commence in January 2015. This highly efficient,
	combined-cycle natural-gas-fired power plant will be located in the town of
	Greater Napanee and will be capable of generating 900 MW under a 20-year
	clean energy supply contract with the IESO. Growth Opportunities Alberta
	continues to be an attractive area for long-term investment with growing
	demand for power and more than 800 MW of coal-fired generation expected to
	come offline around the end of the decade as a portion of the coal fleet
	reaches the end of its useful life. We believe this will present
	opportunities to add new and replacement capacity in the latter half of the
	decade. We will continue to explore further opportunities for growth in
	markets where we have an established presence and a competitive advantage,
	either through development or acquisition. This includes consideration of
	further nuclear refurbishments in Ontario, capacity additions or replacements
	in the northeastern U.S. markets and consideration of new power generation
	facilities in Mexico where we have an established and growing corporate
	presence as this market continues to mature and evolve. The Bruce Nuclear
	facility in Ontario produces approximately one-third of the province&#146;s power
	supply. Located in Queens, NY, the Ravenswood Generating Station is capable
	of providing more than 20 per cent of New York City&#146;s electricity.
	TransCanada operates eight solar generating facilities in Ontario, supplying
	renewable power under a longterm contract. Fuel Sources One-third of the
	power we generate comes from emission-less sources. large photo: TransCanada
	has invested more than $5 billion in emissionless energy assets, including
	the Kibby wind facility in Maine. Natural Gas 51% Coal 15% Nuclear 23% Hydro
	5% Wind 5% Solar 1% 10,900 MW
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100.0%;">
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID;">
<TD WIDTH="92%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:92.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;">
<IMG WIDTH="680" HEIGHT="886" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G2615616DCI021.GIF">
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;WIDTH:4.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" COLOR="WHITE" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="COLOR:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	20 TransCanada
	2014 Kristine Delkus Executive Vice-President and General Counsel Karl
	Johannson Executive Vice-President and President, Natural Gas Pipelines Russ
	Girling President and Chief Executive Officer Wendy Hanrahan Executive
	Vice-President, Corporate Services Bill Taylor Executive Vice-President and
	President, Energy Alex Pourbaix Executive Vice-President and President,
	Development Jim Baggs Executive Vice-President, Operations and Engineering
	Paul Miller Executive Vice-President and President, Liquids Pipelines Don
	Marchand Executive Vice-President and Chief Financial Officer positioned for
	success All the conditions are in place for TransCanada to generate
	significant value and shareholder returns in the years ahead. We have an
	enduring business strategy that has a proven track record over the past 15
	years. We will remain focused on maximizing the value of our existing assets
	and executing on our $46-billion portfolio of commercially secured growth
	projects. And we will continue to pursue the low-risk organic growth
	opportunities generated from our expanding asset base across North America.
	Our strong balance sheet and credit ratings provide the financial flexibility
	to execute our ambitious growth plan, take advantage of new opportunities
	when and where they make sense and allow us to access significant capital on
	compelling terms at all points of the economic cycle. We will continue to
	evaluate funding alternatives and portfolio management to enhance shareholder
	returns, including following through on our commitment to sell our remaining
	U.S. natural gas pipeline assets to our master limited partnership, TC
	PipeLines, LP. Our goal is to maximize long-term shareholder value, with an
	unwavering focus on per-share performance. As we advance our portfolio of
	commercially secured capital growth projects through the end of the decade we
	expect to generate significant sustainable growth in earnings, cash flow and
	dividends. A strong balance sheet provides the financial strength and
	flexibility to execute our ambitious growth plan. executive leadership team
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=5>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="84%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=5>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=5>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;12, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	management's discussion and analysis (MD&amp;A) contains information to help the reader make investment decisions about TransCanada Corporation. It discusses our business, operations, financial
	position, risks and other factors for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	This
	MD&amp;A should be read with our accompanying December&nbsp;31, 2014 audited comparative consolidated financial statements and notes for the same period, which have been prepared in accordance with
	U.S.&nbsp;generally accepted accounting principles&nbsp;(GAAP).
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=4>
	About this document
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Throughout this MD&amp;A, the terms,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	we
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	us
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	our
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	TransCanada
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mean TransCanada Corporation and its subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Abbreviations
	and acronyms that are not defined in the document are defined in the glossary on page&nbsp;120.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	information is as of February&nbsp;12, 2015 and all amounts are in Canadian dollars, unless noted otherwise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

</B>

<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We disclose forward-looking information to help current and potential investors understand management's assessment of our future plans and financial
	outlook, and our future
	prospects overall.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Statements
	that are
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	forward-looking
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	are based on certain assumptions and on what we know and expect today and generally include words like
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	anticipate
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	expect
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	believe
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	may
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	will
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	should
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	estimate
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	or other similar&nbsp;words.
</FONT>
</P>

	statements in this MD&amp;A may include information about the following, among other&nbsp;things:

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_BI75607_1_24">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->

<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	NON-GAAP MEASURES
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We use the following non-GAAP measures:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	EBITDA
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	EBIT
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	funds
	generated from operations
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	earnings
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	earnings per common share
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	EBITDA
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	EBIT
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	depreciation and amortization
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	interest expense
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	interest income and other
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	comparable
	income tax expense.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	measures do not have any standardized meaning as prescribed by U.S.&nbsp;GAAP and therefore may not be similar to measures presented by other&nbsp;entities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	EBITDA and EBIT
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We use EBITDA as an approximate measure of our pre-tax operating cash flow. It measures our earnings before deducting financial charges, income tax, depreciation
	and
	amortization, net income attributable to non-controlling interests and preferred share dividends, and includes income from equity investments. EBIT measures our earnings from ongoing operations and is
	a useful measure of our performance and an effective tool for evaluating trends in each segment as it is equivalent to our segmented earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Funds generated from operations
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Funds generated from operations includes net cash provided by operations before changes in operating working capital. We believe it is a useful
	measure of our consolidated
	operating cash flow because it does not include fluctuations from working capital balances, which do not necessarily reflect underlying operations in the same period and is used to provide a
	consistent measure of the cash generating performance of our assets. See the Financial condition section for a reconciliation to net cash provided by&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	24&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=80,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=11920,FOLIO='24',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]BI75607A.;9',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:26' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_BI75607_1_25">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Comparable measures
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We calculate the comparable measures by adjusting certain GAAP and non-GAAP measures for specific items we believe are significant but not reflective of our
	underlying
	operations in the period. These comparable measures are calculated on a consistent basis from period to period and are adjusted for specific items in each period, as&nbsp;applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our decision not to include a specific item is subjective and made after careful consideration. Specific items may&nbsp;include:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	certain
	fair value adjustments relating to risk management activities
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	income
	tax refunds and adjustments
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	gains
	or losses on sales of assets
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	legal,
	contractual and bankruptcy settlements
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	impact
	of regulatory or arbitration decisions relating to prior year earnings
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	write-downs
	of assets and investments.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	calculate comparable earnings by excluding the unrealized gains and losses from changes in the fair value of certain derivatives used to reduce our exposure to certain financial and commodity price
	risks. These derivatives provide effective economic hedges, but do not meet the criteria for hedge accounting. As a result, the changes in fair value are recorded in net income. As these unrealized
	changes in fair value do not accurately reflect the gains and losses that will be realized at settlement, we do not consider them part of our underlying operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;25
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_CY75607_1_26">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=4>
	About our business
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	With over 60&nbsp;years of experience, TransCanada is a leader in the responsible development and reliable operation of North American energy infrastructure
	including natural gas and liquids pipelines, power generation and natural gas storage facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	THREE CORE BUSINESSES
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We operate our business in three segments&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Natural Gas Pipelines, Liquids Pipelines and Energy. We also have a non-operational corporate
	segment consisting of corporate and administrative functions that provide support and governance to our operational business segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	$59&nbsp;billion portfolio of energy infrastructure assets meets the needs of people who rely on us to deliver their energy safely and reliably every day. We operate in seven Canadian provinces,
	35&nbsp;U.S.&nbsp;states and&nbsp;Mexico.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G358656.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="1135" HEIGHT="1006">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	28&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis

<FONT SIZE=2>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=84,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=617756,FOLIO='28',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DA75607A.;23',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:26' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DB75607_1_29">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	OUR STRATEGY
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our energy infrastructure business is made up of pipeline and power generation assets that gather, transport, produce, store or deliver natural gas, crude oil and
	other
	petroleum products and electricity to support businesses and communities in North&nbsp;America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	vision is to be the leading energy infrastructure company in North America, focusing on pipeline and power generation opportunities in regions where we have or can develop a significant
	competitive advantage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Key components of our strategy
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=6>
<B>
	1&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=1>
<B>
	Maximize the full-life value of our infrastructure assets and commercial positions
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Our strategy at a glance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="61%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3 VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-life infrastructure assets and long-term commercial arrangements are the cornerstones of our low-risk business model.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our pipeline assets include large-scale natural gas and crude oil pipelines that connect long-life supply basins with stable and growing markets, generating predictable and sustainable cash flows and earnings.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;In Energy, long-term power sale agreements and shorter-term power sales to wholesale and load customers are used to manage and optimize our portfolio and to manage price volatility.
<BR>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=6>
<B>
	2&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=1>
<B>
	Commercially develop and build new asset investment programs
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Our strategy at a glance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="61%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3 VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are developing high quality, long-life projects under our current $46&nbsp;billion capital program, comprised of $12&nbsp;billion in short-term projects and $34&nbsp;billion in medium to long-term
	projects. These will contribute incremental earnings over the near, medium and long terms as our investments are placed in service.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our expertise in managing construction risks and maximizing capital productivity ensures a disciplined approach to quality, cost and schedule, resulting in superior service for our customers and returns to shareholders.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;As part of our growth strategy, we rely on this experience and our regulatory, commercial, financial, legal and operational expertise to successfully build and integrate new energy and pipeline facilities.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our growing investment in natural gas, nuclear, wind, hydro and solar generating facilities demonstrates our commitment to clean, sustainable energy.
<BR>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=6>
<B>
	3&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=1>
<B>
	Cultivate a focused portfolio of high quality development options
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Our strategy at a glance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="61%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3 VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;We focus on pipelines and energy growth initiatives in core regions of North America.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;We assess opportunities to acquire and develop energy infrastructure that complements our existing portfolio and provides access to attractive supply and market regions.
<BR>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;We will advance selected opportunities to full development and construction when market conditions are appropriate and project risks and returns are acceptable.
<BR>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=6>
<B>
	4&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=1>
<B>
	Maximize our competitive strengths
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=6>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Our strategy at a glance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="61%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3 VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are continually developing competitive strengths to ensure we provide maximum shareholder value over the short, medium and long terms.
</FONT>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	A competitive advantage
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Years of experience in the energy infrastructure business and a disciplined approach to project and operational management and capital
	investment give us our competitive&nbsp;edge.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong leadership: scale, presence, operating capabilities and strategy development; expertise in regulatory, legal, commercial and
	financing&nbsp;support.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;High quality portfolio: a low-risk business model that maximizes the full-life value of our long-life assets and commercial positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Disciplined operations: highly skilled in designing, building and operating energy infrastructure; focus on operational excellence; and
	a commitment to health, safety and the environment are paramount parts of our core&nbsp;values.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial positioning: excellent reputation for consistent financial performance and long-term financial stability and profitability;
	disciplined approach to capital investment; ability to access sizable amounts of competitively priced capital to support our growth; stable and growing master limited partnership that complements
	our funding program; ability to balance an increasing dividend on our common shares while preserving financial flexibility to fund industry-leading capital program in all market conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term relationships: long-term, transparent relationships with key customers and stakeholders; clear communication of our value to
	equity and debt investors&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;both the upside and the risks&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;to build trust and&nbsp;support.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;29
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=85,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=314966,FOLIO='29',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DB75607A.;11',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:26' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DC75607_1_30">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	CAPITAL PROGRAM
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are developing quality projects under our long-term capital program. These long-life infrastructure assets are supported by long-term commercial arrangements
	with
	creditworthy counterparties or regulated business models and are expected to generate significant growth in earnings and cash&nbsp;flow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	capital program consists of $12&nbsp;billion of small to medium-sized, shorter-term projects and $34&nbsp;billion of commercially secured large-scale, medium and longer-term projects. Amounts
	presented exclude the impact of foreign exchange and capitalized interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	projects are subject to cost adjustments due to market conditions, route refinement, permitting conditions, scheduling and timing of regulatory permits.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DD75607_1_31">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	2014 FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We use certain financial measures that do not have a standardized meaning under GAAP because we believe they improve our ability to compare results
	between reporting periods
	and enhance understanding of our operating performance. Known as non-GAAP measures, they may not be similar to measures provided by other companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_65"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Highlights
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Comparable EBITDA (comparable earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization), comparable EBIT (comparable earnings before interest and taxes),
	comparable
	earnings, comparable earnings per common share and funds generated from operations are all non-GAAP measures. See page&nbsp;24 for more information about the non-GAAP measures we use and
	page&nbsp;112 for a reconciliation to their GAAP equivalents.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

	Net income attributable to common shares

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G604564.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="312" HEIGHT="181">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net
	income attributable to common shares in 2014 was $1,743&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1,712&nbsp;million;
	2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1,299&nbsp;million). The following specific items were recognized in net income in 2012 to&nbsp;2014:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	2014
</U>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a
	gain of $99&nbsp;million after tax on the sale of Cancarb Limited and its related power generation business
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a
	net loss of $32&nbsp;million after tax resulting from a termination payment to Niska Gas Storage for contract restructuring
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a
	gain of $8&nbsp;million after tax on the sale of our 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in Gas Pacifico/INNERGY
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	2013
</U>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	net
	income of $84&nbsp;million recorded in 2013 related to 2012 from the National Energy Board's (NEB) 2013 decision on the Canadian Restructuring Proposal
	(NEB&nbsp;2013&nbsp;Decision)
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a
	favourable tax adjustment of $25&nbsp;million due to the enactment of Canadian Federal tax legislation relating to Part&nbsp;VI.I&nbsp;tax
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>

	Management's discussion and analysis

<FONT SIZE=2>

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DD75607_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	2012
</U>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an
	after-tax charge of $15&nbsp;million related to the Sundance A PPA arbitration decision. This charge was recorded in second quarter 2012 but related to amounts
	originally recorded in fourth quarter&nbsp;2011.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	items discussed above were excluded from comparable earnings for the relevant periods. Certain unrealized fair value adjustments relating to risk management activities are also excluded from
	comparable earnings. The remainder of net income is equivalent to comparable earnings. A reconciliation of net income attributable to common shares to comparable earnings is shown in the following
	table.
</FONT>

</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;33
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=89,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=810091,FOLIO='33',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DD75607A.;50',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DD75607_1_34">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Comparable earnings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G803303.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="288" HEIGHT="181">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Comparable
	earnings in 2014 were $131&nbsp;million higher than in 2013, an increase of $0.18&nbsp;per&nbsp;share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in comparable earnings was primarily the net result of:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	incremental
	earnings from the Gulf Coast extension of the Keystone Pipeline System which was placed in service in January&nbsp;2014
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	interest expense from debt issuances and lower capitalized interest due to projects placed in&nbsp;service
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	lower
	earnings from Western Power as a result of lower realized power prices
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from the Tamazunchale Extension which was placed in service in&nbsp;2014
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from U.S.&nbsp;Natural Gas Pipelines due to higher transportation revenues at Great Lakes reflecting colder winter weather and increased demand, partially
	offset by lower contributions from GTN and Bison following the reductions in our effective ownership in July&nbsp;2013 (GTN&nbsp;and Bison) and October&nbsp;2014&nbsp;(Bison)
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from U.S.&nbsp;Power mainly because of higher realized capacity prices in New&nbsp;York and higher realized power prices for the New&nbsp;York and
	New&nbsp;England facilities
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from the Canadian Mainline due to higher incentive earnings
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	incremental
	earnings from Eastern Power primarily due to solar facilities acquired in 2013 and&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Comparable
	earnings in 2013 were $254&nbsp;million higher than 2012, an increase of $0.35&nbsp;per&nbsp;share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in comparable earnings was the net result of:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	equity income from Bruce Power due to incremental earnings from Units 1 and 2 and lower planned outage days at Unit&nbsp;4
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from the Canadian Mainline reflecting the higher rate of return on common equity (ROE) of 11.50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent in 2013 compared to
	8.08&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent in 2012 due to the NEB 2013&nbsp;Decision
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from U.S.&nbsp;Power because of higher capacity prices in New&nbsp;York and higher realized power&nbsp;prices
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from the NGTL System reflecting a higher investment base and the impact of the 2013-2014 NGTL Settlement approved by the NEB in November&nbsp;2013
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from the Keystone Pipeline System primarily due to higher&nbsp;volumes
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	higher
	earnings from Western Power because of higher purchased volumes under the&nbsp;PPAs
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	lower
	contributions from U.S.&nbsp;Natural Gas Pipelines because of lower earnings at ANR and Great&nbsp;Lakes.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=90,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=336367,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DD75607A.;50',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DD75607_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Cash flows
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Funds generated from operations
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Funds generated from operations
	were 7&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent higher this year compared to 2013 primarily for the same reasons comparable earnings were higher, as described
	above.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_69"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G173440.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="117" HEIGHT="187">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Funds used in investing activities
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Capital spending
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="69%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=7 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->

</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="56%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<B>
	year ended December&nbsp;31
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(millions of $)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<B>
	2014
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	2012

<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Capital
	spending includes capital expenditures and capital projects under development.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="84%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G286213.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="120" HEIGHT="187">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We invested $4.4&nbsp;billion in capital projects in 2014 as part of our ongoing capital program which was consistent with our revised outlook in our third
	quarter 2014 report to shareholders. Our capital program is a key part of our strategy to optimize the value of our existing assets and develop new, complementary assets in high demand areas that are
	expected to generate stable, predictable earnings and cash flows and to maximize returns to shareholders for years to&nbsp;come.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Equity investments and acquisitions
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In 2014, we invested
	$256&nbsp;million in our equity investments primarily related to the construction of Grand Rapids. We also spent $241&nbsp;million on the acquisition
	of four additional solar facilities from Canadian Solar Solutions&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;35
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=91,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=322284,FOLIO='35',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DD75607A.;50',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DD75607_1_36">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Balance sheet
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We continue to maintain a strong balance sheet while growing our total assets by $10.6&nbsp;billion since 2012. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, common equity represented
	38&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent (40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent in 2013) of our capital structure. See page&nbsp;91 for more information about our capital structure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We increased the quarterly dividend on our outstanding common shares by eight per&nbsp;cent to $0.52 per share for the quarter ending March&nbsp;31, 2015 which equates to
	an annual dividend of $2.08 per share. This is the 15th&nbsp;consecutive year we have increased the dividend on our common shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/02/13/0001047469-15-000798_G659143.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="123" HEIGHT="216">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividend reinvestment plan
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Under our dividend reinvestment
	plan (DRP), eligible holders of TransCanada common or preferred shares can reinvest their dividends and make optional cash payments to buy
	additional TransCanada common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Quarterly dividend on our common shares
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$0.52 per share (for&nbsp;the
	quarter ending March&nbsp;31, 2015)
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=92,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=175542,FOLIO='36',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DD75607A.;50',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DE75607_1_37">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	OUTLOOK
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Earnings
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We anticipate earnings in 2015 to be higher than 2014, mainly due to the net effect of the&nbsp;following:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	increase
	in the average investment base for the NGTL System
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	incremental
	earnings from solar facilities acquired in 2014 and higher contractual earnings at&nbsp;B&eacute;cancour
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	anticipated
	higher net margins and production from the U.S.&nbsp;Power assets
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	expected
	earnings associated with increased contracts for ANR
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	decline
	in earnings for the Canadian Mainline as a result of the 2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2030 Tolls and Tariff Application
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reduced
	equity income from Bruce Power due to increased planned maintenance activity and higher operating&nbsp;costs
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	lower
	Alberta power prices and lower contributions from our Natural Gas Storage operations.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Earnings
	will also be impacted by additional Corporate segment items including increased AFUDC reflecting continued growth and capital spending primarily on Topolobampo, Mazatlan, the NGTL System and
	Energy&nbsp;East.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Results
	from our U.S.&nbsp;businesses are subject to fluctuations in foreign exchange rates. These fluctuations are largely offset by interest on our U.S.&nbsp;dollar denominated debt as well as
	our hedging activities which are included in our Corporate segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Natural Gas Pipelines
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Earnings from the Natural Gas
	Pipelines segment are affected by regulatory decisions and the timing of these decisions. Earnings are also impacted by market conditions, which
	drive the level of demand and the rate, we secure for our&nbsp;services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Canadian
	Mainline earnings are anticipated to be lower in 2015 primarily as the result of the 2015&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;2030 Tolls and Tariff Application approved by the NEB in
	November&nbsp;2014. These lower earnings are expected to be largely offset by growth in the NGTL System investment base as we connect new natural gas supply in northeastern B.C. and western Alberta
	and respond to growing demand in the oil sands market in northeast Alberta.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.
	and International Gas Pipelines earnings are expected to be higher in 2015 primarily due to new long-term contracts for ANR originating from the Utica/Marcellus shale&nbsp;plays.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Earnings
	from our existing Mexican pipeline operations are expected to be consistent with&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Liquids Pipelines
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Earnings in 2015 from the Liquids
	Pipelines segment are not expected to be significantly different than 2014. We continue to seek further operational efficiencies which would,
	depending on market demand, improve capacity and flows on the Keystone Pipeline System.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Over
	time, Liquids Pipelines' earnings will increase as projects currently in development are placed in&nbsp;service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Energy
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Earnings in the Energy segment
	are generally maximized by maintaining and optimizing the operations of our power plants and through various marketing activities. Although a
	significant portion of Energy's output is sold under long-term contracts, output that is sold under shorter-term arrangements or at spot prices will continue to be affected by fluctuations in
	commodity prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Western
	Power earnings are anticipated to be lower in 2015 as a result of changing market conditions. Despite continued robust power demand in Alberta, exclusive of any market supply challenges, new
	supply additions in 2015 are expected to result in downward pressure on spot&nbsp;prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Eastern
	Power earnings in 2015 are expected to be higher as a result of a full year of operations from the additional solar assets acquired in 2014 as well as higher contractual earnings
	at&nbsp;B&eacute;cancour.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bruce
	Power equity income is expected to be lower primarily due to the increased planned maintenance activity and higher operating costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=93,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=204536,FOLIO='37',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DE75607A.;12',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DE75607_1_38">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;Power
	earnings are anticipated to increase as a result of higher net energy margins and production partially offset by lower capacity prices for Ravenswood as a result of new supply
	entering the market in&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Natural
	Gas Storage earnings are expected to be slightly lower in 2015 with fewer opportunities to realize shorter-term gas cycling gains such as those realized during periods of extreme volatility
	in&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated capital spending and equity investments
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We expect to spend approximately $6&nbsp;billion in 2015 on new and existing capital projects. The 2015 capital spending
	relates to Natural Gas Pipeline projects including
	NGTL System expansion, the Canadian Mainline, Topolobampo, and Mazatlan; Liquids Pipeline projects including Grand Rapids, Northern Courier, Energy East and Heartland; and Energy projects including
	Napanee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	38&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=94,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=95719,FOLIO='38',FILE='DISK124:[14ZDF7.14ZDF75607]DE75607A.;12',USER='DSCHWAR',CD='12-FEB-2015;20:27' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DG75607_1_39">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=4>
	Natural Gas Pipelines
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our natural gas pipeline network transports natural gas to local distribution companies, power generation facilities and other businesses across Canada, the
	U.S. and Mexico. We serve more than 80&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the Canadian demand and approximately 15&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the U.S.&nbsp;demand on a daily basis by connecting major natural
	gas supply basins and markets through:
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	wholly-owned
	natural gas pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;57,000&nbsp;km (35,500&nbsp;miles)
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	partially-owned
	natural gas pipelines&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;11,000&nbsp;km (6,600&nbsp;miles).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	also have regulated natural gas storage facilities in Michigan with a total capacity of 250&nbsp;Bcf, making us one of the largest providers of natural gas storage and related services in
	North&nbsp;America.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Strategy at a glance
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Optimizing the value of our existing natural gas pipelines systems, while responding to the changing flow patterns of natural gas in North America, is a top&nbsp;priority.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	We are also pursuing new pipeline projects to add incremental value to our business. Our key areas of focus&nbsp;include:
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;greenfield development opportunities, such as infrastructure for liquefied natural gas (LNG) exports from the west coast of Canada and the Gulf of&nbsp;Mexico
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;additional new pipeline developments within Mexico
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;connections to emerging Canadian and U.S.&nbsp;shale gas and other supplies
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;&nbsp;&nbsp;connections to new and growing markets
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="6%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=0>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="43%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	all of which play a critical role in meeting the transportation requirements for supply and demand for natural gas in North&nbsp;America.
<BR>
<BR>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">

<FONT SIZE=2>
	We are the operator of all of the following natural gas pipelines and regulated natural gas storage assets except for&nbsp;Iroquois.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="48%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Connects with Canadian Mainline near the Ontario/Qu&eacute;bec border to transport natural gas to the Montr&eacute;al to Qu&eacute;bec City corridor, and connects with the Portland pipeline system that serves the
	northeast U.S.

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Transports natural gas from the WCSB and the Rocky Mountains to Washington, Oregon and California. Connects with Tuscarora and Foothills. We effectively own 49.8&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the system through the combination of
	our 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent direct ownership interest and our 28.3&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in TC PipeLines,&nbsp;LP
</FONT>

	U.S.&nbsp;upper Midwest. We effectively own 66.7&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the system through the combination of our 53.6&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent direct ownership interest and our 28.3&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in TC PipeLines,&nbsp;LP

	(595&nbsp;miles)

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	RESULTS
</B>
</FONT>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The following is a reconciliation of comparable EBITDA and comparable EBIT (our&nbsp;non-GAAP measures) to segmented earnings (the&nbsp;equivalent GAAP&nbsp;measure).
</FONT>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Natural Gas Pipelines segmented earnings in 2014 increased by $306&nbsp;million compared to 2013 and included $9&nbsp;million related to the gain on sale of
	Gas Pacifico/INNERGY in November&nbsp;2014 whereas the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 included $42&nbsp;million related to the 2012 impact of the NEB 2013&nbsp;Decision. These amounts have
	been excluded in our calculation of comparable EBIT. The remainder of the Natural Gas Pipelines segmented earnings are equivalent to comparable EBIT which, along with comparable EBITDA, are discussed
	below.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Results
	from TQM, Northern Border, Iroquois, TransGas and Gas Pacifico/INNERGY reflect our share of equity income from these investments. In November&nbsp;2014, we sold
	our interest in Gas Pacifico/INNERGY.

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	In
	August&nbsp;2014, TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP began its at-the-market equity issuance program which will decrease our ownership interest in
	TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP going forward. Effective May&nbsp;22, 2013, our ownership interest in TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP decreased from 33.3&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent to
	28.9&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent. On July&nbsp;1, 2013, we sold 45&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of GTN and Bison to TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP. On October&nbsp;1, 2014, we sold our remaining
	30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in Bison to TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP. The following shows our ownership interest in TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP and our effective ownership of Bison, GTN,
	and Great Lakes through our ownership interest in TC PipeLines,&nbsp;LP for the periods presented.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Represents
	our 53.6&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent direct ownership interest. The remaining 46.4&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent is held by TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	4
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Effective
	October&nbsp;1, 2014 we have no direct ownership in Bison. Prior to that our direct ownership interest was 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent effective July&nbsp;1,
	2013, 75&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent effective May&nbsp;2011 and 100&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent prior to that&nbsp;date.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	5
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Effective
	July&nbsp;1, 2013, reflects our direct ownership interest of 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent. Prior to that our direct ownership interest was
	75&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	6
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Represents
	our 61.7&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent ownership interest.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	7
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Includes
	our share of the equity income from Gas Pacifico/INNERGY and TransGas as well as general and administration costs relating to our U.S. and International
	Pipelines. In November&nbsp;2014, we sold our interest in Gas Pacifico/INNERGY.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net income and comparable EBITDA for our rate-regulated Canadian Pipelines are primarily affected by our approved ROE, our investment base, the level of deemed
	common equity, carrying charges owed to shippers on the Canadian Mainline Tolls Stabilization Account (TSA), and incentive earnings. Changes in depreciation, financial charges and income taxes also
	impact comparable EBITDA but do not have a significant impact on net income as they are almost entirely recovered in revenue on a flow-through basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Canadian
	Mainline's comparable earnings this year increased by $23&nbsp;million compared to 2013 because of higher incentive earnings, partially offset by higher carrying charges owed to shippers on
	the positive TSA balance and a lower average investment base. Among other things, the NEB 2013&nbsp;Decision set out an ROE of 11.50&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on deemed common equity of
	40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent for the years 2012 through 2017. Net income of $361&nbsp;million recorded in 2013 included $84&nbsp;million related to the 2012 impact of the NEB 2013&nbsp;Decision,
	which was excluded from comparable earnings. Comparable earnings in 2013 were $90&nbsp;million higher than 2012 because of the impact of the NEB 2013&nbsp;Decision which approved incentive
	earnings and a higher ROE. The ROE used to record earnings in 2012 was 8.08&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on 40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent deemed common&nbsp;equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net
	income for the NGTL System was $2&nbsp;million lower in 2014 compared to 2013. The decrease in net income was due to increased OM&amp;A costs at risk under the terms of the 2013-2014 NGTL Settlement
	approved by the NEB in November&nbsp;2013, partially offset by a higher average investment base. The settlement included an ROE of 10.10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent on deemed common equity of
	40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent and included annual fixed amounts for certain OM&amp;A costs. Net income in 2013 was $35&nbsp;million higher than 2012 because of a higher average investment base and a higher
	ROE. In 2012, the NGTL System was operating under the 2010-2012 Settlement which had
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	44&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's discussion and analysis
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_DI75607_1_45">
