</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="39%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<A NAME="FIS_BALANCE_SHEET_3"></A>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3 ALIGN="CENTER" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2014
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Notes
	receivable are included in Other Current Assets and Intangible and Other Assets on the Consolidated Balance&nbsp;Sheet.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Available
	for sale assets are included in Intangible and Other Assets on the Consolidated Balance&nbsp;Sheet.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Long-Term
	Debt is recorded at amortized cost, except for US$400&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;US$200&nbsp;million) that is attributed to
	hedged risk and recorded at fair&nbsp;value.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	4
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Consolidated
	Net Income in 2014 included losses of $3&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;losses of $5&nbsp;million) for fair value adjustments
	attributable to the hedged interest rate risk associated with interest rate swap fair value hedging relationships on US$400&nbsp;million of Long-Term Debt at December&nbsp;31, 2014
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;US$200&nbsp;million). There were no other unrealized gains or losses from fair value adjustments to the non-derivative financial instruments.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Fair Value of Derivative Instruments
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The fair value of foreign exchange and
	interest rate derivatives have been calculated using the income approach which uses year-end market rates and
	applies a discounted cash flow valuation model. The fair value of power and natural gas derivatives and available for sale assets has been calculated using quoted market prices where available. In the
	absence of quoted market prices, third-party broker quotes or other valuation techniques have been used. Credit risk has been taken into consideration when calculating the fair value of derivative
	instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	some cases, even though the derivatives are considered to be effective economic hedges, they do not meet the specific criteria for hedge accounting treatment or are not
	designated as a hedge and are accounted for at fair value with changes in fair value recorded in Net Income in the period of change. This may expose the Company to increased variability in reported
	earnings because the fair value of the derivative instruments can fluctuate significantly from period to&nbsp;period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Balance Sheet Presentation of Derivative Instruments
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The balance sheet
	classification of the fair value of the derivative instruments is as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	majority of derivative instruments held for trading have been entered into for risk management purposes and all are subject to the Company's risk management
	strategies, policies and limits. These include derivatives that have not been designated as hedges or do not qualify for hedge accounting treatment but have been entered into as economic hedges to
	manage the Company's exposures to market&nbsp;risk.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Fair
	value equals carrying value.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Volumes
	for power and natural gas derivatives are in GWh and Bcf, respectively.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	4
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Realized
	and unrealized gains and losses on held for trading derivative instruments used to purchase and sell power and natural gas are included net in Energy Revenues.
	Realized and unrealized gains and losses on interest rate and foreign exchange derivative instruments held for trading are included net in Interest Expense and Interest Income and Other, respectively.
	The effective portion of the change in fair value of derivative instruments in hedging relationships is initially recognized in OCI and reclassified to Energy Revenues, Interest Expense and Interest
	Income and Other, as appropriate, as the original hedged item&nbsp;settles.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	5
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	All
	hedging relationships are designated as cash flow hedges except for interest rate derivative instruments designated as fair value hedges with a fair value of
	$3&nbsp;million and a notional amount of US$400&nbsp;million. In 2014, net realized gains on fair value hedges were $7&nbsp;million and were included in Interest Expense. In 2014, the Company
	did not record any amounts in Net Income related to ineffectiveness for fair value&nbsp;hedges.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	6
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	In
	2014, there were no gains or losses included in Net Income relating to discontinued cash flow hedges where it was probable that the anticipated transaction would
	not&nbsp;occur.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;173
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	majority of derivative instruments held for trading have been entered into for risk management purposes and all are subject to the Company's risk management
	strategies, policies and limits. These include derivatives that have not been designated as hedges or do not qualify for hedge accounting treatment but have been entered into as economic hedges to
	manage the Company's exposures to market&nbsp;risk.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Fair
	value equals carrying value.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Volumes
	for power and natural gas derivatives are in GWh and Bcf, respectively.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	4
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Realized
	and unrealized gains and losses on held for trading derivative instruments used to purchase and sell power and natural gas are included net in Energy Revenues.
	Realized and unrealized gains and losses on interest rate and foreign exchange derivative instruments held for trading are included net in Interest Expense and Interest Income and Other, respectively.
	The effective portion of the change in fair value of derivative instruments in hedging relationships is initially recognized in OCI and reclassified to Energy Revenues, Interest Expense and Interest
	Income and Other, as appropriate, as the original hedged item&nbsp;settles.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	5
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	All
	hedging relationships are designated as cash flow hedges except for interest rate derivative instruments designated as fair value hedges with a fair value of
	$5&nbsp;million and a notional amount of US$200&nbsp;million. In 2013, net realized gains on fair value hedges were $6&nbsp;million and were included in Interest Expense. In 2013, the Company
	did not record any amounts in Net Income related to ineffectiveness for fair value&nbsp;hedges.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	6
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	In
	2013, there were no gains or losses included in Net Income relating to discontinued cash flow hedges where it was probable that the anticipated transaction would
	not&nbsp;occur.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	174&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	No
	amounts have been excluded from the assessment of hedge effectiveness. Amounts in parentheses indicate losses recorded to&nbsp;OCI.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Reported
	within Energy Revenues on the Consolidated Statement of Income.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Reported
	within Interest Expense on the Consolidated Statement of Income.

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_198"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Offsetting of Derivative Instruments
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Company enters into derivative
	contracts with the right to offset in the normal course of business as well as in the event of default.
	TransCanada has no master netting agreements, however, similar contracts are entered into containing rights of offset. The Company has elected to present the fair value of derivative instruments with
	the right to offset on a gross basis in the balance sheet. The following table shows the impact on the presentation of the fair value of derivative instrument assets and liabilities had the Company
	elected to present these contracts on a net&nbsp;basis:
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="72%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=8 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2 VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	at December&nbsp;31, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">

	Amounts
	available for offset do not include cash collateral pledged or&nbsp;received.

<FONT SIZE=2>

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Amounts
	available for offset do not include cash collateral pledged or&nbsp;received.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	With respect to all financial arrangements, including the derivative instruments presented above as at December&nbsp;31, 2014, the
	Company had provided cash collateral of $459&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$67&nbsp;million) and letters of credit of $26&nbsp;million
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$85&nbsp;million) to its counterparties. The Company held $1&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$11&nbsp;million) in cash
	collateral and $1&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$32&nbsp;million) in letters of credit from counterparties on asset exposures at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Credit Risk Related Contingent Features of Derivative Instruments
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Derivative contracts
	entered into to manage market risk often contain financial assurance provisions that allow parties to the contracts to manage
	credit risk. These provisions may require collateral to be provided if a credit-risk-related contingent event occurs, such as a downgrade in the Company's credit rating to non-investment grade.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on contracts in place and market prices at December&nbsp;31, 2014, the aggregate fair value of all derivative instruments with credit-risk-related contingent
	features that were in a net liability position was $15&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$16&nbsp;million), for which the Company has provided collateral in the normal
	course of business of nil (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;nil). If the credit-risk-related contingent features in these agreements were triggered on December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company
	would have been required to provide additional collateral of $15&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$16&nbsp;million) to its counterparties. Collateral may also need to be
	provided should the fair value of derivative instruments exceed pre-defined contractual exposure limit thresholds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Company has sufficient liquidity in the form of cash and undrawn committed revolving bank lines to meet these contingent obligations should they&nbsp;arise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	176&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=232,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=1027053,FOLIO='176',FILE='DISK125:[14ZDF8.14ZDF75608]FW75608A.;18',USER='SSTALKE',CD='12-FEB-2015;19:44' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_FW75608_1_177">
</A>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_200"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Fair Value Hierarchy
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Company's financial assets and liabilities recorded at fair value have been
	categorized into three categories based on a fair value hierarchy.
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="84%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Levels
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	How fair value has been determined
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Level&nbsp;I
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets and liabilities that the Company has the ability to access at the measurement date.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Level&nbsp;II
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Valuation based on the extrapolation of inputs, other than quoted prices included within Level&nbsp;I, for which all significant inputs are observable directly or indirectly.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	Inputs include published exchange rates, interest rates, interest rate swap curves, yield curves and broker quotes from external data service providers.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	This category includes interest rate and foreign exchange derivative assets and liabilities where fair value is determined using the income approach and power and natural gas commodity derivatives where fair value is determined using the market
	approach.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	Transfers between Level&nbsp;I and Level&nbsp;II would occur when there is a change in market circumstances.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Level&nbsp;III
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Valuation of assets and liabilities are measured using a market approach based on extrapolation of inputs that are unobservable or where observable data does not support a significant portion of the derivatives fair
	value. This category includes long-dated commodity transactions in certain markets where liquidity is low and inputs may include long-term broker quotes.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	Long-term electricity prices may also be estimated using a third-party modeling tool which takes into account physical operating characteristics of generation facilities in the markets in which the Company operates. Model inputs include market
	fundamentals such as fuel prices, power supply additions and retirements, power demand, seasonal hydro conditions and transmission constraints. Long-term North American natural gas prices might be estimated on a view of future natural gas supply and
	demand, as well as exploration and development costs. Significant decreases in fuel prices or demand for electricity or natural gas, or increases in the supply of electricity or natural gas, small number of transactions in markets with lower
	liquidity are expected to or may result in a lower fair value measurement of contracts included in Level&nbsp;III.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="26%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
	Assets and liabilities measured at fair value can fluctuate between Level&nbsp;II and Level&nbsp;III depending on the proportion of the value of the contract that extends beyond the time frame for which significant inputs are considered to be
	observable. As contracts near maturity and observable market data becomes available, they are transferred out of Level&nbsp;III and&nbsp;into Level&nbsp;II.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;177
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_FW75608_1_178">
</A>

	The fair value of the Company's assets and liabilities measured on a recurring basis, including both current and non-current portions for 2014, are
	categorized as&nbsp;follows:

<TD WIDTH="30%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Available for sale assets

<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	There
	were no transfers from Level&nbsp;I to Level&nbsp;II or&nbsp;from Level&nbsp;II to Level&nbsp;III for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

	for 2013, are categorized as&nbsp;follows:

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Energy
	Revenues include unrealized gains attributed to derivatives in the Level&nbsp;III category that were still held at December&nbsp;31, 2014 of $3&nbsp;million
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;nil).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A 10&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent increase or decrease in commodity prices, with all other variables held constant, would result in a
	$1&nbsp;million decrease or increase, respectively, in the fair value of outstanding derivative instruments included in Level&nbsp;III as at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As part of a purchase
	agreement with Canadian Solar Solutions&nbsp;Inc. signed in 2011, TransCanada completed the acquisition of three Ontario
	solar facilities for $181&nbsp;million in September&nbsp;2014 and acquired a fourth facility for $60&nbsp;million in December&nbsp;2014. In 2013, TransCanada completed the acquisition of four
	solar facilities for $216&nbsp;million. The Company's total investment in the eight solar facilities is $457&nbsp;million. All power produced by the solar facilities is sold under 20-year PPAs
	with the Ontario Power Authority.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;179
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=235,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=351498,FOLIO='179',FILE='DISK125:[14ZDF8.14ZDF75608]FY75608A.;10',USER='SSTALKE',CD='12-FEB-2015;19:44' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_FY75608_1_180">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Cancarb
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On April&nbsp;15, 2014,
	TransCanada sold Cancarb Limited and its related power generation for aggregate gross proceeds of $190&nbsp;million.
	Please refer to Note&nbsp;6 for further information on the&nbsp;sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	CrossAlta
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In December&nbsp;2012,
	TransCanada purchased BP's 40&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in the assets of the Crossfield Gas Storage facility and BP's
	interest in CrossAlta Gas Storage&nbsp;&amp; Services&nbsp;Ltd. (collectively CrossAlta) for $214&nbsp;million in cash, net of cash acquired, resulting in the Company owning and operating
	100&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of these operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Company measured the assets and liabilities acquired at fair value and the transaction resulted in no goodwill. Upon completion of the acquisition, TransCanada began
	consolidating CrossAlta. Prior to the acquisition, TransCanada applied equity accounting to its 60&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent ownership interest in&nbsp;CrossAlta.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Natural Gas Pipelines
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On October&nbsp;1, 2014,
	TransCanada completed the sale of its remaining 30&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in Bison Pipeline&nbsp;LLC
	(Bison&nbsp;LLC) to TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP for an aggregate purchase price of US$215&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	July&nbsp;2013, TransCanada completed the sale of a 45&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent interest in each of GTN&nbsp;LLC and Bison&nbsp;LLC to TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP
	for an aggregate purchase price of US$1.05&nbsp;billion, which included US$146&nbsp;million of long-term debt for 45&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of GTN&nbsp;LLC debt outstanding, plus normal closing
	adjustments. GTN&nbsp;LLC and Bison&nbsp;LLC own the GTN and Bison natural gas pipelines, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	May&nbsp;2013, TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP completed a public offering of 8,855,000&nbsp;common units at a price of US$43.85 per unit, resulting in gross proceeds
	of approximately US$388&nbsp;million and net proceeds of US$373&nbsp;million after unit issuance costs. TransCanada contributed approximately US$8&nbsp;million to maintain its two
	per&nbsp;cent general partnership interest and did not purchase any other units. Upon completion of this offering, TransCanada's ownership interest in TC&nbsp;PipeLines,&nbsp;LP decreased from
	33.3&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent to 28.9&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent and an after-tax dilution gain of $29&nbsp;million ($47&nbsp;million pre-tax) was recorded in Additional Paid-In Capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Gas Pacifico/INNERGY
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On November&nbsp;26, 2014,
	TransCanada sold its 30 per&nbsp;cent equity investments in Gas Pacifico and INNERGY for aggregate gross proceeds of
	$9&nbsp;million and recognized a gain of $9&nbsp;million ($8&nbsp;million after&nbsp;tax).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	180&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The operating lease agreements for premises, services and equipment expire at various dates through 2052, with an option to renew
	certain lease agreements for periods of one year to five years. Net rental expense on operating leases in 2014 was $114&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$98&nbsp;million;
	2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$84&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada's
	commitments under the Alberta PPAs are considered to be operating leases and a portion of these PPAs have been subleased to third parties under similar terms
	and conditions. Fixed payments under these PPAs have been included in the above operating leases table. Variable payments have been excluded as these payments are dependent upon plant availability and
	other factors. TransCanada's share of payments under the PPAs in 2014 was $391&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$242&nbsp;million;
	2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$238&nbsp;million). The generating capacities and expiry dates of the PPAs are as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada and its affiliates have long-term natural gas transportation and natural gas purchase arrangements as well as other
	purchase obligations, all of which are transacted at market prices and in the normal course of&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Other Commitments
<BR>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Capital expenditure
	commitments include obligations related to the construction of growth projects and are based on the projects proceeding as
	planned. Changes to these projects, including cancellation, would reduce or possibly eliminate these commitments as a result of cost mitigation efforts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, TransCanada was committed to Natural Gas Pipelines capital expenditures totaling approximately $0.9&nbsp;billion
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1.3&nbsp;billion), primarily related to construction costs related to the Mexican and other natural gas pipeline projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company was committed to Liquids Pipelines capital expenditures totaling approximately $1.8&nbsp;billion
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$2.5&nbsp;billion), primarily related to construction costs of Keystone XL, Grand Rapids and Northern Courier.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company was committed to Energy capital expenditures totaling approximately $0.2&nbsp;billion
	(2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$0.1&nbsp;billion), primarily related to capital costs of the Napanee Generating Station.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Consolidated financial statements
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2014&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;181
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=237,EFW="2222941",CP="TRANSCANADA CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=51618,FOLIO='181',FILE='DISK125:[14ZDF8.14ZDF75608]FY75608A.;10',USER='SSTALKE',CD='12-FEB-2015;19:44' -->
<A NAME="A2222941Z40-F_HTM_PAGE_FY75608_1_182">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Contingencies
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada is subject to laws and regulations governing environmental quality and
	pollution control. As at December&nbsp;31, 2014, the Company had
	accrued approximately $31&nbsp;million (2013&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$32&nbsp;million; 2012&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$37&nbsp;million) related to operating
	facilities, which represents the present value of the estimated future amount it expects to expend to remediate the sites. However, additional liabilities may be incurred as assessments occur and
	remediation efforts continue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada
	and its subsidiaries are subject to various legal proceedings, arbitrations and actions arising in the normal course of business. While the final outcome of such
	legal proceedings and actions cannot be predicted with certainty, it is the opinion of management that the resolution of such proceedings and actions will not have a material impact on the Company's
	consolidated financial position or results of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TXTHEX,"PMS287" -->
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR="#0C2E82" SIZE=2>
<B>
	Guarantees
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada and its joint venture partner on Bruce Power, BPC Generation
	Infrastructure Trust (BPC), have each severally guaranteed certain
	contingent financial obligations of Bruce B related to a lease agreement and contractor and supplier services. In addition, TransCanada and BPC have each severally guaranteed one-half of certain
	contingent financial obligations of Bruce A related to a sublease agreement and certain other financial obligations. The Company's exposure under certain of these guarantees is&nbsp;unlimited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	addition to the guarantees for Bruce Power, the Company and its partners in certain other jointly owned entities have either (i)&nbsp;jointly and severally,
	(ii)&nbsp;jointly or (iii)&nbsp;severally guaranteed the financial performance of these entities related primarily to redelivery of natural gas, PPA payments and the payment of liabilities. For
	certain of these entities, any payments made by TransCanada under these guarantees in excess of its ownership interest are to be reimbursed by its&nbsp;partners.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	carrying value of these guarantees has been included in Other Long-Term Liabilities. Information regarding the Company's guarantees is as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->

	Floating Rate Senior Notes due January&nbsp;12,&nbsp;2018.

	2.8
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.8
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.6
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.9
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=12 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<HR NOSHADE>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	As
	at December&nbsp;31.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	price/book multiple is determined by dividing price per common share by book value per common share as calculated by dividing common shareholders' equity by the number
	of common shares outstanding as at December&nbsp;31.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	3
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Preferred
	shares were issued for Series&nbsp;1, 3, 5, 7 and&nbsp;9 in September&nbsp;2009, March&nbsp;2010, June&nbsp;2010, March&nbsp;2013 and
	January&nbsp;2014, respectively, with annual dividend rates of $1.15, $1.00, $1.10, $1.00 and $1.09 per share, respectively. The first quarterly dividends for each series were paid in
	December&nbsp;2009, June&nbsp;2010, November&nbsp;2010, April&nbsp;2013 and January&nbsp;2014, respectively.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	4
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	dividend yield is determined by dividing dividends per common share declared during the year by price per common share as at December&nbsp;31.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	5
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Price
	per common share refers to market price per share as reported on the Toronto Stock Exchange as at December&nbsp;31.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	6
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	price/earnings multiple is determined by dividing price per common share by the basic net income per&nbsp;share.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	7
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Debt
	includes Junior Subordinated Notes, total long-term debt, including the current portion of long-term debt, plus preferred securities as at December&nbsp;31 and
	excludes long-term debt of joint ventures. Shareholders' equity in this ratio is as at December&nbsp;31.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	8
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	Total
	shareholder return is the sum of the change in price per common share plus the dividends received plus the impact of dividend re-investment in a calendar year,
	expressed as a percentage of the value of shares at the end of the previous&nbsp;year.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TOP:-2PT;ADD_SUP:2PT;">
	9
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	The
	earnings to fixed charges ratio is determined by dividing earnings by fixed charges. Earnings is calculated as the sum of EBIT and interest income and other, less
	income attributable to non-controlling interests with interest expense and undistributed earnings of investments accounted for by the equity method. Fixed charges is calculated as the sum of interest
	expense, and capitalized interest.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada Corporation
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2014
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;185
</FONT>
</P>

	TransCanada Corporation
</B>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Annual Meeting
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The annual and special meeting of shareholders is scheduled for May&nbsp;1, 2015 at 10:00&nbsp;a.m. (Mountain Daylight
	Time) at the BMO&nbsp;Centre, Calgary, Alberta.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividend Payment Dates
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Scheduled common share dividend payment dates in 2015 are January&nbsp;30, April&nbsp;30, July&nbsp;31 and
	October&nbsp;30.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	information on dividend payment dates for TransCanada Corporation visit our website at www.transcanada.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividend Reinvestment and Share Purchase Plan
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TransCanada's dividend reinvestment and share purchase plan (Plan) allows common and
	preferred shareholders of TransCanada to purchase common shares of TransCanada by reinvesting their cash dividends without incurring brokerage or administrative fees. Participants in the Plan may also
	buy additional common shares, up to Cdn$10,000 per quarter. For more information on the Plan please contact our Plan agent, Computershare Trust Company of Canada or visit our website at
	www.transcanada.com.
</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=4>
	Shareholder assistance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If you are a registered shareholder and have questions regarding your account, please contact our transfer agent in writing, by telephone or e-mail&nbsp;at:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Computershare
	Trust Company of Canada, 100&nbsp;University Avenue, 8th&nbsp;Floor, Toronto, Ontario, Canada M5J&nbsp;2Y1
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="70%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Toll-free: 1.800.340.5024
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Telephone: 1.514.982.7959
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	E-mail: transcanada@computershare.com
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	www.computershare.com
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If
	you hold your shares in a brokerage account (beneficial shareholder), questions should be directed to your broker on all administrative matters.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	If
	you would like to receive quarterly reports, please contact Computershare or visit our website at www.transcanada.com.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Electronic Proxy Voting and Delivery of Documents
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TransCanada is pleased to offer registered and beneficial shareholders the ability to
	receive their documents (annual report, management information circular, notice of meeting and view-only proxy form) and vote online.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In
	2015, registered shareholders who opt to receive their documents electronically will have a tree planted on their behalf through eTree. For more information and to sign up online, registered
	shareholders can visit www.etree.ca/transcanada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Shareholders
	also have the ability to choose whether to receive TransCanada's annual report by regular mail. Each year, shareholders are required to renew their option and will receive a notification
	for doing so. The annual report is available on the TransCanada website at www.transcanada.com at the same time that the report is mailed to shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Electronic
	delivery and the ability to opt out of receiving the annual report by mail, provides increased convenience to shareholders, benefits to the environment and reduced mailing and printing
	costs for the&nbsp;company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	TransCanada in the Community
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TransCanada's annual Corporate Responsibility Report is available at www.transcanada.com. If you would like to
	receive a copy of this report by mail, please&nbsp;contact:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Communications
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;450 1st Street SW, Calgary, Alberta T2P&nbsp;5H1, 1.403.920.2000 or 1.800.661.3805 or Communications@transcanada.com
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Visit
	our website at www.transcanada.com to access TransCanada's corporate and financial information, including quarterly reports, news releases, real-time conference call webcasts and investor
	presentations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Si
	vous d&eacute;sirez vous procurer un exemplaire de ce rapport en fran&ccedil;ais, veuillez consulter notre site Web ou vous adresser par &eacute;crit &agrave;
	TransCanada Corporation, bureau du&nbsp;secr&eacute;taire.
</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#0C2E82">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<BR>
<FONT COLOR="#0033E1" SIZE=4>
	Corporate governance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Please refer to TransCanada's Notice of 2015 annual and special meeting of shareholders and Management information circular for the company's statement of
	corporate governance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TransCanada's
	Corporate Governance Guidelines, Board charter, Committee charters, Chair and Chief Executive Officer terms of reference and Code of business ethics are available on our website at
	www.transcanada.com. Also available on our website is a summary of the significant ways in which TransCanada's corporate governance practices differ from those required to be followed by
	U.S.&nbsp;domestic companies under the New&nbsp;York Stock Exchange's listing standards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Additional
	information relating to the company is filed with securities regulators in Canada on SEDAR (www.sedar.com) and in the United&nbsp;States on EDGAR (www.sec.gov). The documents referred to
	in this Annual report may be obtained free of charge by contacting TransCanada's Corporate Secretary at 450&nbsp;1st&nbsp;Street SW, Calgary, Alberta, Canada T2P&nbsp;5H1, or by telephoning
	1.800.661.3805.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Ethics Help-Line
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors has established an anonymous and confidential toll-free telephone number for employees,
	contractors and others to call with respect to accounting irregularities and ethical violations. The Ethics Help-Line number is 1.888.920.2042.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_23>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_23"></A>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3>
<A HREF="#A2222941ZEX-23_1_HTM_14ZDF75614_2">
	QuickLinks

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- PARA=JUSTIFY -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-23_1_HTM_KA75614_EXHIBIT_23_1">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-23_1_HTM_TOC_KA75614_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;23.1
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_EXPERTS_CONSENT>
<A NAME="FIS_EXPERTS_CONSENT"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	To
	the Board of Directors of TransCanada Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	consent to the use of our reports, each dated February&nbsp;12, 2015, with respect to the consolidated financial statements and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting
	included in this annual report on Form&nbsp;40-F.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	also consent to the incorporation by reference of such reports in TransCanada Corporation's:
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Registration
	Statements No.&nbsp;333-5916, No.&nbsp;333-8470, No.&nbsp;333-9130, No.&nbsp;333-184074 and No.&nbsp;333-151736 of
	Form&nbsp;S-8;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Registration
	Statements No.&nbsp;33-13564 and No.&nbsp;333-6132 on Form&nbsp;F-3; and,
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Registration
	Statements No.&nbsp;333-151781, No.&nbsp;333-161929 and No.&nbsp;333-192561 on Form&nbsp;F-10.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	KPMG&nbsp;LLP
<BR>
	Chartered Accountants
<BR>
	Calgary, Canada
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	February&nbsp;13,
	2015
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3>
<A HREF="#A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_14ZDF75614_3">
	QuickLinks
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=3>
	-- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document
</FONT>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_PAGE_KC75614_1_1">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- PARA=JUSTIFY -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_KC75614_EXHIBIT_31_1">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_TOC_KC75614_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;31.1
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_KC75614_CERTIFICATIONS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_1_HTM_TOC_KC75614_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Certifications
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I, Russell K. Girling, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I
	have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;40-F of TransCanada Corporation;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
	made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this&nbsp;report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the
	financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this&nbsp;report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as&nbsp;defined in
	Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and&nbsp;15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as&nbsp;defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and&nbsp;15d-15(f)) for the issuer
	and&nbsp;have:
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that
	material information relating to the issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
	being&nbsp;prepared;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to
	provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
	principles;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Evaluated
	the effectiveness of the issuer's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
	disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Disclosed
	in this report any change in the issuer's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report
	that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the issuer's internal control over financial reporting;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the
	issuer's auditors and the audit committee of the issuer's board of directors (or&nbsp;persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to
	adversely affect the issuer's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any
	fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the issuer's internal control over financial
	reporting.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Dated
	February&nbsp;13, 2015
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_2_HTM_PAGE_KE75614_1_2">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_2_HTM_KE75614_EXHIBIT_31_2">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_2_HTM_TOC_KE75614_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;31.2
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_2_HTM_KE75614_CERTIFICATIONS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2222941ZEX-31_2_HTM_TOC_KE75614_2">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Certifications
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I,
	Donald R. Marchand, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I
	have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;40-F of TransCanada Corporation;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
	made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this&nbsp;report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the
	financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this&nbsp;report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as&nbsp;defined in
	Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and&nbsp;15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as&nbsp;defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and&nbsp;15d-15(f)) for the issuer
	and&nbsp;have:
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that
	material information relating to the issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
	being&nbsp;prepared;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to
	provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
	principles;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Evaluated
	the effectiveness of the issuer's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the
	disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Disclosed
	in this report any change in the issuer's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report
	that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the issuer's internal control over financial reporting;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the
	issuer's auditors and the audit committee of the issuer's board of directors (or&nbsp;persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to
	adversely affect the issuer's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any
	fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the issuer's internal control over financial
	reporting.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Dated
	February&nbsp;13, 2015
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
<BR>
	UNDER SECTION&nbsp;906 OF SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF&nbsp;2002
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I,
	Russell K. Girling, the Chief Executive Officer of TransCanada Corporation (the&nbsp;"Company"), in compliance with 18&nbsp;U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906
	of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, hereby certify, in connection with the Company's annual report as filed on Form&nbsp;40-F for the fiscal year ending December&nbsp;31, 2014 with the Securities
	and Exchange Commission (the&nbsp;"Report"),&nbsp;that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or&nbsp;15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CERTIFICATION OF CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER
<BR>
	UNDER SECTION&nbsp;906 OF SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF&nbsp;2002
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I,
	Donald R. Marchand, the Chief Financial Officer of TransCanada Corporation (the&nbsp;"Company"), in compliance with 18&nbsp;U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906
	of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, hereby certify, in connection with the Company's annual report as filed on Form&nbsp;40-F for the fiscal year ending December&nbsp;31, 2014 with the Securities
	and Exchange Commission (the&nbsp;"Report"),&nbsp;that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or&nbsp;15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

	&nbsp;
